00041 #include "o2iblnd.h"

00043 static void kiblnd_peer_alive(kib_peer_t *peer);
00044 static void kiblnd_peer_connect_failed(kib_peer_t *peer, int active, int error);
00045 static void kiblnd_check_sends(kib_conn_t *conn);
00046 static void kiblnd_init_tx_msg(lnet_ni_t *ni, kib_tx_t *tx,
00047                                int type, int body_nob);
00048 static int kiblnd_init_rdma(kib_conn_t *conn, kib_tx_t *tx, int type,
00049                             int resid, kib_rdma_desc_t *dstrd, __u64 dstcookie);
00050 static void kiblnd_queue_tx_locked(kib_tx_t *tx, kib_conn_t *conn);
00051 static void kiblnd_queue_tx(kib_tx_t *tx, kib_conn_t *conn);
00052 static void kiblnd_unmap_tx(lnet_ni_t *ni, kib_tx_t *tx);
00053 
00054 static void
00055 kiblnd_tx_done (lnet_ni_t *ni, kib_tx_t *tx)
00056 {
00057         lnet_msg_t *lntmsg[2];
00058         kib_net_t  *net = ni->ni_data;
00059         int         rc;
00060         int         i;
00061 
00062         LASSERT (net != NULL);
00063         LASSERT (!in_interrupt());
00064         LASSERT (!tx->tx_queued);               /* mustn't be queued for sending */
00065         LASSERT (tx->tx_sending == 0);          /* mustn't be awaiting sent callback */
00066         LASSERT (!tx->tx_waiting);              /* mustn't be awaiting peer response */
00067         LASSERT (tx->tx_pool != NULL);
00068 
00069         kiblnd_unmap_tx(ni, tx);
00070 
00071         /* tx may have up to 2 lnet msgs to finalise */
00072         lntmsg[0] = tx->tx_lntmsg[0]; tx->tx_lntmsg[0] = NULL;
00073         lntmsg[1] = tx->tx_lntmsg[1]; tx->tx_lntmsg[1] = NULL;
00074         rc = tx->tx_status;
00075 
00076         if (tx->tx_conn != NULL) {
00077                 LASSERT (ni == tx->tx_conn->ibc_peer->ibp_ni);
00078 
00079                 kiblnd_conn_decref(tx->tx_conn);
00080                 tx->tx_conn = NULL;
00081         }
00082 
00083         tx->tx_nwrq = 0;
00084         tx->tx_status = 0;
00085 
00086         kiblnd_pool_free_node(&tx->tx_pool->tpo_pool, &tx->tx_list);
00087 
00088         /* delay finalize until my descs have been freed */
00089         for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
00090                 if (lntmsg[i] == NULL)
00091                         continue;
00092 
00093                 lnet_finalize(ni, lntmsg[i], rc);
00094         }
00095 }
00096 
00097 void
00098 kiblnd_txlist_done(lnet_ni_t *ni, struct list_head *txlist, int status)
00099 {
00100         kib_tx_t *tx;
00101 
00102         while (!list_empty(txlist)) {
00103                 tx = list_entry(txlist->next, kib_tx_t, tx_list);
00104 
00105                 list_del(&tx->tx_list);
00106                 /* complete now */
00107                 tx->tx_waiting = 0;
00108                 tx->tx_status = status;
00109                 kiblnd_tx_done(ni, tx);
00110         }
00111 }
00112 
00113 static kib_tx_t *
00114 kiblnd_get_idle_tx(lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_nid_t target)
00115 {
00116         kib_net_t               *net = (kib_net_t *)ni->ni_data;
00117         struct list_head        *node;
00118         kib_tx_t                *tx;
00119         kib_tx_poolset_t        *tps;
00120 
00121         tps = net->ibn_tx_ps[lnet_cpt_of_nid(target)];
00122         node = kiblnd_pool_alloc_node(&tps->tps_poolset);
00123         if (node == NULL)
00124                 return NULL;
00125         tx = container_of(node, kib_tx_t, tx_list);
00126 
00127         LASSERT (tx->tx_nwrq == 0);
00128         LASSERT (!tx->tx_queued);
00129         LASSERT (tx->tx_sending == 0);
00130         LASSERT (!tx->tx_waiting);
00131         LASSERT (tx->tx_status == 0);
00132         LASSERT (tx->tx_conn == NULL);
00133         LASSERT (tx->tx_lntmsg[0] == NULL);
00134         LASSERT (tx->tx_lntmsg[1] == NULL);
00135         LASSERT (tx->tx_nfrags == 0);
00136 
00137         return tx;
00138 }
00139 
00140 static void
00141 kiblnd_drop_rx(kib_rx_t *rx)
00142 {
00143         kib_conn_t              *conn   = rx->rx_conn;
00144         struct kib_sched_info   *sched  = conn->ibc_sched;
00145         unsigned long           flags;
00146 
00147         spin_lock_irqsave(&sched->ibs_lock, flags);
00148         LASSERT(conn->ibc_nrx > 0);
00149         conn->ibc_nrx--;
00150         spin_unlock_irqrestore(&sched->ibs_lock, flags);
00151 
00152         kiblnd_conn_decref(conn);
00153 }
00154 
00155 int
00156 kiblnd_post_rx (kib_rx_t *rx, int credit)
00157 {
00158         kib_conn_t         *conn = rx->rx_conn;
00159         kib_net_t          *net = conn->ibc_peer->ibp_ni->ni_data;
00160         struct ib_recv_wr  *bad_wrq = NULL;
00161         struct ib_mr       *mr = conn->ibc_hdev->ibh_mrs;
00162         int                 rc;
00163 
00164         LASSERT (net != NULL);
00165         LASSERT (!in_interrupt());
00166         LASSERT (credit == IBLND_POSTRX_NO_CREDIT ||
00167                  credit == IBLND_POSTRX_PEER_CREDIT ||
00168                  credit == IBLND_POSTRX_RSRVD_CREDIT);
00169         LASSERT(mr != NULL);
00170 
00171         rx->rx_sge.lkey   = mr->lkey;
00172         rx->rx_sge.addr   = rx->rx_msgaddr;
00173         rx->rx_sge.length = IBLND_MSG_SIZE;
00174 
00175         rx->rx_wrq.next = NULL;
00176         rx->rx_wrq.sg_list = &rx->rx_sge;
00177         rx->rx_wrq.num_sge = 1;
00178         rx->rx_wrq.wr_id = kiblnd_ptr2wreqid(rx, IBLND_WID_RX);
00179 
00180         LASSERT (conn->ibc_state >= IBLND_CONN_INIT);
00181         LASSERT (rx->rx_nob >= 0);              /* not posted */
00182 
00183         if (conn->ibc_state > IBLND_CONN_ESTABLISHED) {
00184                 kiblnd_drop_rx(rx);             /* No more posts for this rx */
00185                 return 0;
00186         }
00187 
00188         rx->rx_nob = -1;                        /* flag posted */
00189 
00190         /* NB: need an extra reference after ib_post_recv because we don't
00191          * own this rx (and rx::rx_conn) anymore, LU-5678.
00192          */
00193         kiblnd_conn_addref(conn);
00194         rc = ib_post_recv(conn->ibc_cmid->qp, &rx->rx_wrq, &bad_wrq);
00195         if (unlikely(rc != 0)) {
00196                 CERROR("Can't post rx for %s: %d, bad_wrq: %p\n",
00197                        libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid), rc, bad_wrq);
00198                 rx->rx_nob = 0;
00199         }
00200 
00201         if (conn->ibc_state < IBLND_CONN_ESTABLISHED) /* Initial post */
00202                 goto out;
00203 
00204         if (unlikely(rc != 0)) {
00205                 kiblnd_close_conn(conn, rc);
00206                 kiblnd_drop_rx(rx);     /* No more posts for this rx */
00207                 goto out;
00208         }
00209 
00210         if (credit == IBLND_POSTRX_NO_CREDIT)
00211                 goto out;
00212 
00213         spin_lock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00214         if (credit == IBLND_POSTRX_PEER_CREDIT)
00215                 conn->ibc_outstanding_credits++;
00216         else
00217                 conn->ibc_reserved_credits++;
00218         spin_unlock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00219 
00220         kiblnd_check_sends(conn);
00221 out:
00222         kiblnd_conn_decref(conn);
00223         return rc;
00224 }
00225 
00226 static kib_tx_t *
00227 kiblnd_find_waiting_tx_locked(kib_conn_t *conn, int txtype, __u64 cookie)
00228 {
00229         struct list_head *tmp;
00230 
00231         list_for_each(tmp, &conn->ibc_active_txs) {
00232                 kib_tx_t *tx = list_entry(tmp, kib_tx_t, tx_list);
00233 
00234                 LASSERT(!tx->tx_queued);
00235                 LASSERT(tx->tx_sending != 0 || tx->tx_waiting);
00236 
00237                 if (tx->tx_cookie != cookie)
00238                         continue;
00239 
00240                 if (tx->tx_waiting &&
00241                     tx->tx_msg->ibm_type == txtype)
00242                         return tx;
00243 
00244                 CWARN("Bad completion: %swaiting, type %x (wanted %x)\n",
00245                       tx->tx_waiting ? "" : "NOT ",
00246                       tx->tx_msg->ibm_type, txtype);
00247         }
00248         return NULL;
00249 }
00250 
00251 static void
00252 kiblnd_handle_completion(kib_conn_t *conn, int txtype, int status, __u64 cookie)
00253 {
00254         kib_tx_t    *tx;
00255         lnet_ni_t   *ni = conn->ibc_peer->ibp_ni;
00256         int          idle;
00257 
00258         spin_lock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00259 
00260         tx = kiblnd_find_waiting_tx_locked(conn, txtype, cookie);
00261         if (tx == NULL) {
00262                 spin_unlock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00263 
00264                 CWARN("Unmatched completion type %x cookie "LPX64" from %s\n",
00265                       txtype, cookie, libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid));
00266                 kiblnd_close_conn(conn, -EPROTO);
00267                 return;
00268         }
00269 
00270         if (tx->tx_status == 0) {               /* success so far */
00271                 if (status < 0) {               /* failed? */
00272                         tx->tx_status = status;
00273                 } else if (txtype == IBLND_MSG_GET_REQ) {
00274                         lnet_set_reply_msg_len(ni, tx->tx_lntmsg[1], status);
00275                 }
00276         }
00277 
00278         tx->tx_waiting = 0;
00279 
00280         idle = !tx->tx_queued && (tx->tx_sending == 0);
00281         if (idle)
00282                 list_del(&tx->tx_list);
00283 
00284         spin_unlock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00285 
00286         if (idle)
00287                 kiblnd_tx_done(ni, tx);
00288 }
00289 
00290 static void
00291 kiblnd_send_completion(kib_conn_t *conn, int type, int status, __u64 cookie)
00292 {
00293         lnet_ni_t   *ni = conn->ibc_peer->ibp_ni;
00294         kib_tx_t    *tx = kiblnd_get_idle_tx(ni, conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid);
00295 
00296         if (tx == NULL) {
00297                 CERROR("Can't get tx for completion %x for %s\n",
00298                        type, libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid));
00299                 return;
00300         }
00301 
00302         tx->tx_msg->ibm_u.completion.ibcm_status = status;
00303         tx->tx_msg->ibm_u.completion.ibcm_cookie = cookie;
00304         kiblnd_init_tx_msg(ni, tx, type, sizeof(kib_completion_msg_t));
00305 
00306         kiblnd_queue_tx(tx, conn);
00307 }
00308 
00309 static void
00310 kiblnd_handle_rx (kib_rx_t *rx)
00311 {
00312         kib_msg_t    *msg = rx->rx_msg;
00313         kib_conn_t   *conn = rx->rx_conn;
00314         lnet_ni_t    *ni = conn->ibc_peer->ibp_ni;
00315         int           credits = msg->ibm_credits;
00316         kib_tx_t     *tx;
00317         int           rc = 0;
00318         int           rc2;
00319         int           post_credit;
00320 
00321         LASSERT (conn->ibc_state >= IBLND_CONN_ESTABLISHED);
00322 
00323         CDEBUG (D_NET, "Received %x[%d] from %s\n",
00324                 msg->ibm_type, credits,
00325                 libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid));
00326 
00327         if (credits != 0) {
00328                 /* Have I received credits that will let me send? */
00329                 spin_lock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00330 
00331                 if (conn->ibc_credits + credits >
00332                     conn->ibc_queue_depth) {
00333                         rc2 = conn->ibc_credits;
00334                         spin_unlock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00335 
00336                         CERROR("Bad credits from %s: %d + %d > %d\n",
00337                                libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid),
00338                                rc2, credits,
00339                                conn->ibc_queue_depth);
00340 
00341                         kiblnd_close_conn(conn, -EPROTO);
00342                         kiblnd_post_rx(rx, IBLND_POSTRX_NO_CREDIT);
00343                         return;
00344                 }
00345 
00346                 conn->ibc_credits += credits;
00347 
00348                 /* This ensures the credit taken by NOOP can be returned */
00349                 if (msg->ibm_type == IBLND_MSG_NOOP &&
00350                     !IBLND_OOB_CAPABLE(conn->ibc_version)) /* v1 only */
00351                         conn->ibc_outstanding_credits++;
00352 
00353                 spin_unlock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00354                 kiblnd_check_sends(conn);
00355         }
00356 
00357         switch (msg->ibm_type) {
00358         default:
00359                 CERROR("Bad IBLND message type %x from %s\n",
00360                        msg->ibm_type, libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid));
00361                 post_credit = IBLND_POSTRX_NO_CREDIT;
00362                 rc = -EPROTO;
00363                 break;
00364 
00365         case IBLND_MSG_NOOP:
00366                 if (IBLND_OOB_CAPABLE(conn->ibc_version)) {
00367                         post_credit = IBLND_POSTRX_NO_CREDIT;
00368                         break;
00369                 }
00370 
00371                 if (credits != 0) /* credit already posted */
00372                         post_credit = IBLND_POSTRX_NO_CREDIT;
00373                 else              /* a keepalive NOOP */
00374                         post_credit = IBLND_POSTRX_PEER_CREDIT;
00375                 break;
00376 
00377         case IBLND_MSG_IMMEDIATE:
00378                 post_credit = IBLND_POSTRX_DONT_POST;
00379                 rc = lnet_parse(ni, &msg->ibm_u.immediate.ibim_hdr,
00380                                 msg->ibm_srcnid, rx, 0);
00381                 if (rc < 0)                     /* repost on error */
00382                         post_credit = IBLND_POSTRX_PEER_CREDIT;
00383                 break;
00384 
00385         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_REQ:
00386                 post_credit = IBLND_POSTRX_DONT_POST;
00387                 rc = lnet_parse(ni, &msg->ibm_u.putreq.ibprm_hdr,
00388                                 msg->ibm_srcnid, rx, 1);
00389                 if (rc < 0)                     /* repost on error */
00390                         post_credit = IBLND_POSTRX_PEER_CREDIT;
00391                 break;
00392 
00393         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_NAK:
00394                 CWARN ("PUT_NACK from %s\n",
00395                        libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid));
00396                 post_credit = IBLND_POSTRX_RSRVD_CREDIT;
00397                 kiblnd_handle_completion(conn, IBLND_MSG_PUT_REQ,
00398                                          msg->ibm_u.completion.ibcm_status,
00399                                          msg->ibm_u.completion.ibcm_cookie);
00400                 break;
00401 
00402         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_ACK:
00403                 post_credit = IBLND_POSTRX_RSRVD_CREDIT;
00404 
00405                 spin_lock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00406                 tx = kiblnd_find_waiting_tx_locked(conn, IBLND_MSG_PUT_REQ,
00407                                         msg->ibm_u.putack.ibpam_src_cookie);
00408                 if (tx != NULL)
00409                         list_del(&tx->tx_list);
00410                 spin_unlock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00411 
00412                 if (tx == NULL) {
00413                         CERROR("Unmatched PUT_ACK from %s\n",
00414                                libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid));
00415                         rc = -EPROTO;
00416                         break;
00417                 }
00418 
00419                 LASSERT (tx->tx_waiting);
00420                 /* CAVEAT EMPTOR: I could be racing with tx_complete, but...
00421                  * (a) I can overwrite tx_msg since my peer has received it!
00422                  * (b) tx_waiting set tells tx_complete() it's not done. */
00423 
00424                 tx->tx_nwrq = 0;                /* overwrite PUT_REQ */
00425 
00426                 rc2 = kiblnd_init_rdma(conn, tx, IBLND_MSG_PUT_DONE,
00427                                        kiblnd_rd_size(&msg->ibm_u.putack.ibpam_rd),
00428                                        &msg->ibm_u.putack.ibpam_rd,
00429                                        msg->ibm_u.putack.ibpam_dst_cookie);
00430                 if (rc2 < 0)
00431                         CERROR("Can't setup rdma for PUT to %s: %d\n",
00432                                libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid), rc2);
00433 
00434                 spin_lock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00435                 tx->tx_waiting = 0;     /* clear waiting and queue atomically */
00436                 kiblnd_queue_tx_locked(tx, conn);
00437                 spin_unlock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00438                 break;
00439 
00440         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_DONE:
00441                 post_credit = IBLND_POSTRX_PEER_CREDIT;
00442                 kiblnd_handle_completion(conn, IBLND_MSG_PUT_ACK,
00443                                          msg->ibm_u.completion.ibcm_status,
00444                                          msg->ibm_u.completion.ibcm_cookie);
00445                 break;
00446 
00447         case IBLND_MSG_GET_REQ:
00448                 post_credit = IBLND_POSTRX_DONT_POST;
00449                 rc = lnet_parse(ni, &msg->ibm_u.get.ibgm_hdr,
00450                                 msg->ibm_srcnid, rx, 1);
00451                 if (rc < 0)                     /* repost on error */
00452                         post_credit = IBLND_POSTRX_PEER_CREDIT;
00453                 break;
00454 
00455         case IBLND_MSG_GET_DONE:
00456                 post_credit = IBLND_POSTRX_RSRVD_CREDIT;
00457                 kiblnd_handle_completion(conn, IBLND_MSG_GET_REQ,
00458                                          msg->ibm_u.completion.ibcm_status,
00459                                          msg->ibm_u.completion.ibcm_cookie);
00460                 break;
00461         }
00462 
00463         if (rc < 0)                             /* protocol error */
00464                 kiblnd_close_conn(conn, rc);
00465 
00466         if (post_credit != IBLND_POSTRX_DONT_POST)
00467                 kiblnd_post_rx(rx, post_credit);
00468 }
00469 
00470 static void
00471 kiblnd_rx_complete (kib_rx_t *rx, int status, int nob)
00472 {
00473         kib_msg_t    *msg = rx->rx_msg;
00474         kib_conn_t   *conn = rx->rx_conn;
00475         lnet_ni_t    *ni = conn->ibc_peer->ibp_ni;
00476         kib_net_t    *net = ni->ni_data;
00477         int           rc;
00478         int           err = -EIO;
00479 
00480         LASSERT (net != NULL);
00481         LASSERT (rx->rx_nob < 0);               /* was posted */
00482         rx->rx_nob = 0;                         /* isn't now */
00483 
00484         if (conn->ibc_state > IBLND_CONN_ESTABLISHED)
00485                 goto ignore;
00486 
00487         if (status != IB_WC_SUCCESS) {
00488                 CNETERR("Rx from %s failed: %d\n",
00489                         libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid), status);
00490                 goto failed;
00491         }
00492 
00493         LASSERT (nob >= 0);
00494         rx->rx_nob = nob;
00495 
00496         rc = kiblnd_unpack_msg(msg, rx->rx_nob);
00497         if (rc != 0) {
00498                 CERROR ("Error %d unpacking rx from %s\n",
00499                         rc, libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid));
00500                 goto failed;
00501         }
00502 
00503         if (msg->ibm_srcnid != conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid ||
00504             msg->ibm_dstnid != ni->ni_nid ||
00505             msg->ibm_srcstamp != conn->ibc_incarnation ||
00506             msg->ibm_dststamp != net->ibn_incarnation) {
00507                 CERROR ("Stale rx from %s\n",
00508                         libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid));
00509                 err = -ESTALE;
00510                 goto failed;
00511         }
00512 
00513         /* set time last known alive */
00514         kiblnd_peer_alive(conn->ibc_peer);
00515 
00516         /* racing with connection establishment/teardown! */
00517 
00518         if (conn->ibc_state < IBLND_CONN_ESTABLISHED) {
00519                 rwlock_t  *g_lock = &kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock;
00520                 unsigned long  flags;
00521 
00522                 write_lock_irqsave(g_lock, flags);
00523                 /* must check holding global lock to eliminate race */
00524                 if (conn->ibc_state < IBLND_CONN_ESTABLISHED) {
00525                         list_add_tail(&rx->rx_list, &conn->ibc_early_rxs);
00526                         write_unlock_irqrestore(g_lock, flags);
00527                         return;
00528                 }
00529                 write_unlock_irqrestore(g_lock, flags);
00530         }
00531         kiblnd_handle_rx(rx);
00532         return;
00533 
00534  failed:
00535         CDEBUG(D_NET, "rx %p conn %p\n", rx, conn);
00536         kiblnd_close_conn(conn, err);
00537  ignore:
00538         kiblnd_drop_rx(rx);                     /* Don't re-post rx. */
00539 }
00540 
00541 static struct page *
00542 kiblnd_kvaddr_to_page (unsigned long vaddr)
00543 {
00544         struct page *page;
00545 
00546         if (is_vmalloc_addr((void *)vaddr)) {
00547                 page = vmalloc_to_page ((void *)vaddr);
00548                 LASSERT (page != NULL);
00549                 return page;
00550         }
00551 #ifdef CONFIG_HIGHMEM
00552         if (vaddr >= PKMAP_BASE &&
00553             vaddr < (PKMAP_BASE + LAST_PKMAP * PAGE_SIZE)) {
00554                 /* No highmem pages only used for bulk (kiov) I/O */
00555                 CERROR("find page for address in highmem\n");
00556                 LBUG();
00557         }
00558 #endif
00559         page = virt_to_page (vaddr);
00560         LASSERT (page != NULL);
00561         return page;
00562 }
00563 
00564 static int
00565 kiblnd_fmr_map_tx(kib_net_t *net, kib_tx_t *tx, kib_rdma_desc_t *rd, __u32 nob)
00566 {
00567         kib_hca_dev_t           *hdev;
00568         kib_fmr_poolset_t       *fps;
00569         int                     cpt;
00570         int                     rc;
00571 
00572         LASSERT(tx->tx_pool != NULL);
00573         LASSERT(tx->tx_pool->tpo_pool.po_owner != NULL);
00574 
00575         hdev = tx->tx_pool->tpo_hdev;
00576         cpt = tx->tx_pool->tpo_pool.po_owner->ps_cpt;
00577 
00578         fps = net->ibn_fmr_ps[cpt];
00579         rc = kiblnd_fmr_pool_map(fps, tx, rd, nob, 0, &tx->fmr);
00580         if (rc != 0) {
00581                 CERROR("Can't map %u pages: %d\n", nob, rc);
00582                 return rc;
00583         }
00584 
00585         /* If rd is not tx_rd, it's going to get sent to a peer, who will need
00586          * the rkey */
00587         rd->rd_key = tx->fmr.fmr_key;
00588         rd->rd_frags[0].rf_addr &= ~hdev->ibh_page_mask;
00589         rd->rd_frags[0].rf_nob   = nob;
00590         rd->rd_nfrags = 1;
00591 
00592         return 0;
00593 }
00594 
00595 static void
00596 kiblnd_unmap_tx(lnet_ni_t *ni, kib_tx_t *tx)
00597 {
00598         kib_net_t  *net = ni->ni_data;
00599 
00600         LASSERT(net != NULL);
00601 
00602         if (net->ibn_fmr_ps != NULL)
00603                 kiblnd_fmr_pool_unmap(&tx->fmr, tx->tx_status);
00604 
00605         if (tx->tx_nfrags != 0) {
00606                 kiblnd_dma_unmap_sg(tx->tx_pool->tpo_hdev->ibh_ibdev,
00607                                     tx->tx_frags, tx->tx_nfrags, tx->tx_dmadir);
00608                 tx->tx_nfrags = 0;
00609         }
00610 }
00611 
00612 static int
00613 kiblnd_map_tx(lnet_ni_t *ni, kib_tx_t *tx, kib_rdma_desc_t *rd, int nfrags)
00614 {
00615         kib_net_t     *net   = ni->ni_data;
00616         kib_hca_dev_t *hdev  = net->ibn_dev->ibd_hdev;
00617         struct ib_mr  *mr    = NULL;
00618         __u32 nob;
00619         int i;
00620 
00621         /* If rd is not tx_rd, it's going to get sent to a peer and I'm the
00622          * RDMA sink */
00623         tx->tx_dmadir = (rd != tx->tx_rd) ? DMA_FROM_DEVICE : DMA_TO_DEVICE;
00624         tx->tx_nfrags = nfrags;
00625 
00626         rd->rd_nfrags = kiblnd_dma_map_sg(hdev->ibh_ibdev, tx->tx_frags,
00627                                           tx->tx_nfrags, tx->tx_dmadir);
00628 
00629         for (i = 0, nob = 0; i < rd->rd_nfrags; i++) {
00630                 rd->rd_frags[i].rf_nob  = kiblnd_sg_dma_len(
00631                         hdev->ibh_ibdev, &tx->tx_frags[i]);
00632                 rd->rd_frags[i].rf_addr = kiblnd_sg_dma_address(
00633                         hdev->ibh_ibdev, &tx->tx_frags[i]);
00634                 nob += rd->rd_frags[i].rf_nob;
00635         }
00636 
00637         mr = kiblnd_find_rd_dma_mr(ni, rd,
00638                                    (tx->tx_conn != NULL) ?
00639                                    tx->tx_conn->ibc_max_frags : -1);
00640         if (mr != NULL) {
00641                 /* found pre-mapping MR */
00642                 rd->rd_key = (rd != tx->tx_rd) ? mr->rkey : mr->lkey;
00643                 return 0;
00644         }
00645 
00646         if (net->ibn_fmr_ps != NULL)
00647                 return kiblnd_fmr_map_tx(net, tx, rd, nob);
00648 
00649         return -EINVAL;
00650 }
00651 
00652 
00653 static int
00654 kiblnd_setup_rd_iov(lnet_ni_t *ni, kib_tx_t *tx, kib_rdma_desc_t *rd,
00655                     unsigned int niov, struct kvec *iov, int offset, int nob)
00656 {
00657         kib_net_t          *net = ni->ni_data;
00658         struct page        *page;
00659         struct scatterlist *sg;
00660         unsigned long       vaddr;
00661         int                 fragnob;
00662         int                 page_offset;
00663 
00664         LASSERT (nob > 0);
00665         LASSERT (niov > 0);
00666         LASSERT (net != NULL);
00667 
00668         while (offset >= iov->iov_len) {
00669                 offset -= iov->iov_len;
00670                 niov--;
00671                 iov++;
00672                 LASSERT (niov > 0);
00673         }
00674 
00675         sg = tx->tx_frags;
00676         do {
00677                 LASSERT (niov > 0);
00678 
00679                 vaddr = ((unsigned long)iov->iov_base) + offset;
00680                 page_offset = vaddr & (PAGE_SIZE - 1);
00681                 page = kiblnd_kvaddr_to_page(vaddr);
00682                 if (page == NULL) {
00683                         CERROR ("Can't find page\n");
00684                         return -EFAULT;
00685                 }
00686 
00687                 fragnob = min((int)(iov->iov_len - offset), nob);
00688                 fragnob = min(fragnob, (int)PAGE_SIZE - page_offset);
00689 
00690                 sg_set_page(sg, page, fragnob, page_offset);
00691                 sg++;
00692 
00693                 if (offset + fragnob < iov->iov_len) {
00694                         offset += fragnob;
00695                 } else {
00696                         offset = 0;
00697                         iov++;
00698                         niov--;
00699                 }
00700                 nob -= fragnob;
00701         } while (nob > 0);
00702 
00703         return kiblnd_map_tx(ni, tx, rd, sg - tx->tx_frags);
00704 }
00705 
00706 static int
00707 kiblnd_setup_rd_kiov (lnet_ni_t *ni, kib_tx_t *tx, kib_rdma_desc_t *rd,
00708                       int nkiov, lnet_kiov_t *kiov, int offset, int nob)
00709 {
00710         kib_net_t          *net = ni->ni_data;
00711         struct scatterlist *sg;
00712         int                 fragnob;
00713 
00714         CDEBUG(D_NET, "niov %d offset %d nob %d\n", nkiov, offset, nob);
00715 
00716         LASSERT (nob > 0);
00717         LASSERT (nkiov > 0);
00718         LASSERT (net != NULL);
00719 
00720         while (offset >= kiov->kiov_len) {
00721                 offset -= kiov->kiov_len;
00722                 nkiov--;
00723                 kiov++;
00724                 LASSERT (nkiov > 0);
00725         }
00726 
00727         sg = tx->tx_frags;
00728         do {
00729                 LASSERT (nkiov > 0);
00730 
00731                 fragnob = min((int)(kiov->kiov_len - offset), nob);
00732 
00733                 sg_set_page(sg, kiov->kiov_page, fragnob,
00734                             kiov->kiov_offset + offset);
00735                 sg++;
00736 
00737                 offset = 0;
00738                 kiov++;
00739                 nkiov--;
00740                 nob -= fragnob;
00741         } while (nob > 0);
00742 
00743         return kiblnd_map_tx(ni, tx, rd, sg - tx->tx_frags);
00744 }
00745 
00746 static int
00747 kiblnd_post_tx_locked (kib_conn_t *conn, kib_tx_t *tx, int credit)
00748 __must_hold(&conn->ibc_lock)
00749 {
00750         kib_msg_t         *msg = tx->tx_msg;
00751         kib_peer_t        *peer = conn->ibc_peer;
00752         struct lnet_ni    *ni = peer->ibp_ni;
00753         int                ver = conn->ibc_version;
00754         int                rc;
00755         int                done;
00756 
00757         LASSERT(tx->tx_queued);
00758         /* We rely on this for QP sizing */
00759         LASSERT(tx->tx_nwrq > 0);
00760         LASSERT(tx->tx_nwrq <= 1 + conn->ibc_max_frags);
00761 
00762         LASSERT(credit == 0 || credit == 1);
00763         LASSERT(conn->ibc_outstanding_credits >= 0);
00764         LASSERT(conn->ibc_outstanding_credits <= conn->ibc_queue_depth);
00765         LASSERT(conn->ibc_credits >= 0);
00766         LASSERT(conn->ibc_credits <= conn->ibc_queue_depth);
00767 
00768         if (conn->ibc_nsends_posted ==
00769             kiblnd_concurrent_sends(ver, ni)) {
00770                 /* tx completions outstanding... */
00771                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "%s: posted enough\n",
00772                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid));
00773                 return -EAGAIN;
00774         }
00775 
00776         if (credit != 0 && conn->ibc_credits == 0) {   /* no credits */
00777                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "%s: no credits\n",
00778                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid));
00779                 return -EAGAIN;
00780         }
00781 
00782         if (credit != 0 && !IBLND_OOB_CAPABLE(ver) &&
00783             conn->ibc_credits == 1 &&   /* last credit reserved */
00784             msg->ibm_type != IBLND_MSG_NOOP) {      /* for NOOP */
00785                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "%s: not using last credit\n",
00786                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid));
00787                 return -EAGAIN;
00788         }
00789 
00790         /* NB don't drop ibc_lock before bumping tx_sending */
00791         list_del(&tx->tx_list);
00792         tx->tx_queued = 0;
00793 
00794         if (msg->ibm_type == IBLND_MSG_NOOP &&
00795             (!kiblnd_need_noop(conn) ||     /* redundant NOOP */
00796              (IBLND_OOB_CAPABLE(ver) && /* posted enough NOOP */
00797               conn->ibc_noops_posted == IBLND_OOB_MSGS(ver)))) {
00798                 /* OK to drop when posted enough NOOPs, since
00799                  * kiblnd_check_sends will queue NOOP again when
00800                  * posted NOOPs complete */
00801                 spin_unlock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00802                 kiblnd_tx_done(peer->ibp_ni, tx);
00803                 spin_lock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00804                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "%s(%d): redundant or enough NOOP\n",
00805                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid),
00806                        conn->ibc_noops_posted);
00807                 return 0;
00808         }
00809 
00810         kiblnd_pack_msg(peer->ibp_ni, msg, ver, conn->ibc_outstanding_credits,
00811                         peer->ibp_nid, conn->ibc_incarnation);
00812 
00813         conn->ibc_credits -= credit;
00814         conn->ibc_outstanding_credits = 0;
00815         conn->ibc_nsends_posted++;
00816         if (msg->ibm_type == IBLND_MSG_NOOP)
00817                 conn->ibc_noops_posted++;
00818 
00819         /* CAVEAT EMPTOR!  This tx could be the PUT_DONE of an RDMA
00820          * PUT.  If so, it was first queued here as a PUT_REQ, sent and
00821          * stashed on ibc_active_txs, matched by an incoming PUT_ACK,
00822          * and then re-queued here.  It's (just) possible that
00823          * tx_sending is non-zero if we've not done the tx_complete()
00824          * from the first send; hence the ++ rather than = below. */
00825         tx->tx_sending++;
00826         list_add(&tx->tx_list, &conn->ibc_active_txs);
00827 
00828         /* I'm still holding ibc_lock! */
00829         if (conn->ibc_state != IBLND_CONN_ESTABLISHED) {
00830                 rc = -ECONNABORTED;
00831         } else if (tx->tx_pool->tpo_pool.po_failed ||
00832                  conn->ibc_hdev != tx->tx_pool->tpo_hdev) {
00833                 /* close_conn will launch failover */
00834                 rc = -ENETDOWN;
00835         } else {
00836                 struct kib_fast_reg_descriptor *frd = tx->fmr.fmr_frd;
00837                 struct ib_send_wr *bad = &tx->tx_wrq[tx->tx_nwrq - 1].wr;
00838                 struct ib_send_wr *wr  = &tx->tx_wrq[0].wr;
00839 
00840                 if (frd != NULL) {
00841                         if (!frd->frd_valid) {
00842                                 wr = &frd->frd_inv_wr.wr;
00843                                 wr->next = &frd->frd_fastreg_wr.wr;
00844                         } else {
00845                                 wr = &frd->frd_fastreg_wr.wr;
00846                         }
00847                         frd->frd_fastreg_wr.wr.next = &tx->tx_wrq[0].wr;
00848                 }
00849 
00850                 LASSERTF(bad->wr_id == kiblnd_ptr2wreqid(tx, IBLND_WID_TX),
00851                          "bad wr_id "LPX64", opc %d, flags %d, peer: %s\n",
00852                          bad->wr_id, bad->opcode, bad->send_flags,
00853                          libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid));
00854 
00855                 bad = NULL;
00856                 rc = ib_post_send(conn->ibc_cmid->qp, wr, &bad);
00857         }
00858 
00859         conn->ibc_last_send = jiffies;
00860 
00861         if (rc == 0)
00862                 return 0;
00863 
00864         /* NB credits are transferred in the actual
00865          * message, which can only be the last work item */
00866         conn->ibc_credits += credit;
00867         conn->ibc_outstanding_credits += msg->ibm_credits;
00868         conn->ibc_nsends_posted--;
00869         if (msg->ibm_type == IBLND_MSG_NOOP)
00870                 conn->ibc_noops_posted--;
00871 
00872         tx->tx_status = rc;
00873         tx->tx_waiting = 0;
00874         tx->tx_sending--;
00875 
00876         done = (tx->tx_sending == 0);
00877         if (done)
00878                 list_del(&tx->tx_list);
00879 
00880         spin_unlock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00881 
00882         if (conn->ibc_state == IBLND_CONN_ESTABLISHED)
00883                 CERROR("Error %d posting transmit to %s\n",
00884                        rc, libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid));
00885         else
00886                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "Error %d posting transmit to %s\n",
00887                        rc, libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid));
00888 
00889         kiblnd_close_conn(conn, rc);
00890 
00891         if (done)
00892                 kiblnd_tx_done(peer->ibp_ni, tx);
00893 
00894         spin_lock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00895 
00896         return -EIO;
00897 }
00898 
00899 static void
00900 kiblnd_check_sends (kib_conn_t *conn)
00901 {
00902         int        ver = conn->ibc_version;
00903         lnet_ni_t *ni = conn->ibc_peer->ibp_ni;
00904         kib_tx_t  *tx;
00905 
00906         /* Don't send anything until after the connection is established */
00907         if (conn->ibc_state < IBLND_CONN_ESTABLISHED) {
00908                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "%s too soon\n",
00909                        libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid));
00910                 return;
00911         }
00912 
00913         spin_lock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00914 
00915         LASSERT(conn->ibc_nsends_posted <=
00916                 kiblnd_concurrent_sends(ver, ni));
00917         LASSERT (!IBLND_OOB_CAPABLE(ver) ||
00918                  conn->ibc_noops_posted <= IBLND_OOB_MSGS(ver));
00919         LASSERT (conn->ibc_reserved_credits >= 0);
00920 
00921         while (conn->ibc_reserved_credits > 0 &&
00922                !list_empty(&conn->ibc_tx_queue_rsrvd)) {
00923                 tx = list_entry(conn->ibc_tx_queue_rsrvd.next,
00924                                     kib_tx_t, tx_list);
00925                 list_del(&tx->tx_list);
00926                 list_add_tail(&tx->tx_list, &conn->ibc_tx_queue);
00927                 conn->ibc_reserved_credits--;
00928         }
00929 
00930         if (kiblnd_need_noop(conn)) {
00931                 spin_unlock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00932 
00933                 tx = kiblnd_get_idle_tx(ni, conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid);
00934                 if (tx != NULL)
00935                         kiblnd_init_tx_msg(ni, tx, IBLND_MSG_NOOP, 0);
00936 
00937                 spin_lock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00938                 if (tx != NULL)
00939                         kiblnd_queue_tx_locked(tx, conn);
00940         }
00941 
00942         for (;;) {
00943                 int credit;
00944 
00945                 if (!list_empty(&conn->ibc_tx_queue_nocred)) {
00946                         credit = 0;
00947                         tx = list_entry(conn->ibc_tx_queue_nocred.next,
00948                                             kib_tx_t, tx_list);
00949                 } else if (!list_empty(&conn->ibc_tx_noops)) {
00950                         LASSERT (!IBLND_OOB_CAPABLE(ver));
00951                         credit = 1;
00952                         tx = list_entry(conn->ibc_tx_noops.next,
00953                                         kib_tx_t, tx_list);
00954                 } else if (!list_empty(&conn->ibc_tx_queue)) {
00955                         credit = 1;
00956                         tx = list_entry(conn->ibc_tx_queue.next,
00957                                             kib_tx_t, tx_list);
00958                 } else
00959                         break;
00960 
00961                 if (kiblnd_post_tx_locked(conn, tx, credit) != 0)
00962                         break;
00963         }
00964 
00965         spin_unlock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00966 }
00967 
00968 static void
00969 kiblnd_tx_complete (kib_tx_t *tx, int status)
00970 {
00971         int           failed = (status != IB_WC_SUCCESS);
00972         kib_conn_t   *conn = tx->tx_conn;
00973         int           idle;
00974 
00975         LASSERT (tx->tx_sending > 0);
00976 
00977         if (failed) {
00978                 if (conn->ibc_state == IBLND_CONN_ESTABLISHED)
00979                         CNETERR("Tx -> %s cookie "LPX64
00980                                 " sending %d waiting %d: failed %d\n",
00981                                 libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid),
00982                                 tx->tx_cookie, tx->tx_sending, tx->tx_waiting,
00983                                 status);
00984 
00985                 kiblnd_close_conn(conn, -EIO);
00986         } else {
00987                 kiblnd_peer_alive(conn->ibc_peer);
00988         }
00989 
00990         spin_lock(&conn->ibc_lock);
00991 
00992         /* I could be racing with rdma completion.  Whoever makes 'tx' idle
00993          * gets to free it, which also drops its ref on 'conn'. */
00994 
00995         tx->tx_sending--;
00996         conn->ibc_nsends_posted--;
00997         if (tx->tx_msg->ibm_type == IBLND_MSG_NOOP)
00998                 conn->ibc_noops_posted--;
00999 
01000         if (failed) {
01001                 tx->tx_waiting = 0;             /* don't wait for peer */
01002                 tx->tx_status = -EIO;
01003         }
01004 
01005         idle = (tx->tx_sending == 0) &&         /* This is the final callback */
01006                !tx->tx_waiting &&               /* Not waiting for peer */
01007                !tx->tx_queued;                  /* Not re-queued (PUT_DONE) */
01008         if (idle)
01009                 list_del(&tx->tx_list);
01010 
01011         kiblnd_conn_addref(conn);               /* 1 ref for me.... */
01012 
01013         spin_unlock(&conn->ibc_lock);
01014 
01015         if (idle)
01016                 kiblnd_tx_done(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_ni, tx);
01017 
01018         kiblnd_check_sends(conn);
01019 
01020         kiblnd_conn_decref(conn);               /* ...until here */
01021 }
01022 
01023 static void
01024 kiblnd_init_tx_msg (lnet_ni_t *ni, kib_tx_t *tx, int type, int body_nob)
01025 {
01026         kib_hca_dev_t *hdev = tx->tx_pool->tpo_hdev;
01027         struct ib_sge *sge = &tx->tx_sge[tx->tx_nwrq];
01028         struct ib_rdma_wr *wrq;
01029         int nob = offsetof(kib_msg_t, ibm_u) + body_nob;
01030         struct ib_mr *mr = hdev->ibh_mrs;
01031 
01032         LASSERT(tx->tx_nwrq >= 0);
01033         LASSERT(tx->tx_nwrq < IBLND_MAX_RDMA_FRAGS + 1);
01034         LASSERT(nob <= IBLND_MSG_SIZE);
01035         LASSERT(mr != NULL);
01036 
01037         kiblnd_init_msg(tx->tx_msg, type, body_nob);
01038 
01039         sge->lkey   = mr->lkey;
01040         sge->addr   = tx->tx_msgaddr;
01041         sge->length = nob;
01042 
01043         wrq = &tx->tx_wrq[tx->tx_nwrq];
01044         memset(wrq, 0, sizeof(*wrq));
01045 
01046         wrq->wr.next            = NULL;
01047         wrq->wr.wr_id           = kiblnd_ptr2wreqid(tx, IBLND_WID_TX);
01048         wrq->wr.sg_list         = sge;
01049         wrq->wr.num_sge         = 1;
01050         wrq->wr.opcode          = IB_WR_SEND;
01051         wrq->wr.send_flags      = IB_SEND_SIGNALED;
01052 
01053         tx->tx_nwrq++;
01054 }
01055 
01056 static int
01057 kiblnd_init_rdma(kib_conn_t *conn, kib_tx_t *tx, int type,
01058                  int resid, kib_rdma_desc_t *dstrd, __u64 dstcookie)
01059 {
01060         kib_msg_t         *ibmsg = tx->tx_msg;
01061         kib_rdma_desc_t   *srcrd = tx->tx_rd;
01062         struct ib_sge     *sge = &tx->tx_sge[0];
01063         struct ib_rdma_wr *wrq;
01064         int                rc  = resid;
01065         int                srcidx;
01066         int                dstidx;
01067         int                wrknob;
01068 
01069         LASSERT (!in_interrupt());
01070         LASSERT (tx->tx_nwrq == 0);
01071         LASSERT (type == IBLND_MSG_GET_DONE ||
01072                  type == IBLND_MSG_PUT_DONE);
01073 
01074         srcidx = dstidx = 0;
01075 
01076         while (resid > 0) {
01077                 if (srcidx >= srcrd->rd_nfrags) {
01078                         CERROR("Src buffer exhausted: %d frags\n", srcidx);
01079                         rc = -EPROTO;
01080                         break;
01081                 }
01082 
01083                 if (dstidx == dstrd->rd_nfrags) {
01084                         CERROR("Dst buffer exhausted: %d frags\n", dstidx);
01085                         rc = -EPROTO;
01086                         break;
01087                 }
01088 
01089                 if (tx->tx_nwrq >= conn->ibc_max_frags) {
01090                         CERROR("RDMA has too many fragments for peer %s (%d), "
01091                                "src idx/frags: %d/%d dst idx/frags: %d/%d\n",
01092                                libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid),
01093                                conn->ibc_max_frags,
01094                                srcidx, srcrd->rd_nfrags,
01095                                dstidx, dstrd->rd_nfrags);
01096                         rc = -EMSGSIZE;
01097                         break;
01098                 }
01099 
01100                 wrknob = MIN(MIN(kiblnd_rd_frag_size(srcrd, srcidx),
01101                                  kiblnd_rd_frag_size(dstrd, dstidx)), resid);
01102 
01103                 sge = &tx->tx_sge[tx->tx_nwrq];
01104                 sge->addr   = kiblnd_rd_frag_addr(srcrd, srcidx);
01105                 sge->lkey   = kiblnd_rd_frag_key(srcrd, srcidx);
01106                 sge->length = wrknob;
01107 
01108                 wrq = &tx->tx_wrq[tx->tx_nwrq];
01109 
01110                 wrq->wr.next            = &(wrq + 1)->wr;
01111                 wrq->wr.wr_id           = kiblnd_ptr2wreqid(tx, IBLND_WID_RDMA);
01112                 wrq->wr.sg_list         = sge;
01113                 wrq->wr.num_sge         = 1;
01114                 wrq->wr.opcode          = IB_WR_RDMA_WRITE;
01115                 wrq->wr.send_flags      = 0;
01116 
01117 #ifdef HAVE_IB_RDMA_WR
01118                 wrq->remote_addr        = kiblnd_rd_frag_addr(dstrd, dstidx);
01119                 wrq->rkey               = kiblnd_rd_frag_key(dstrd, dstidx);
01120 #else
01121                 wrq->wr.wr.rdma.remote_addr = kiblnd_rd_frag_addr(dstrd, dstidx);
01122                 wrq->wr.wr.rdma.rkey    = kiblnd_rd_frag_key(dstrd, dstidx);
01123 #endif
01124 
01125                 srcidx = kiblnd_rd_consume_frag(srcrd, srcidx, wrknob);
01126                 dstidx = kiblnd_rd_consume_frag(dstrd, dstidx, wrknob);
01127 
01128                 resid -= wrknob;
01129 
01130                 tx->tx_nwrq++;
01131                 wrq++;
01132                 sge++;
01133         }
01134 
01135         if (rc < 0)                             /* no RDMA if completing with failure */
01136                 tx->tx_nwrq = 0;
01137 
01138         ibmsg->ibm_u.completion.ibcm_status = rc;
01139         ibmsg->ibm_u.completion.ibcm_cookie = dstcookie;
01140         kiblnd_init_tx_msg(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_ni, tx,
01141                            type, sizeof (kib_completion_msg_t));
01142 
01143         return rc;
01144 }
01145 
01146 static void
01147 kiblnd_queue_tx_locked(kib_tx_t *tx, kib_conn_t *conn)
01148 {
01149         struct list_head *q;
01150 
01151         LASSERT(tx->tx_nwrq > 0);       /* work items set up */
01152         LASSERT(!tx->tx_queued);        /* not queued for sending already */
01153         LASSERT(conn->ibc_state >= IBLND_CONN_ESTABLISHED);
01154 
01155         tx->tx_queued = 1;
01156         tx->tx_deadline = jiffies +
01157                           msecs_to_jiffies(*kiblnd_tunables.kib_timeout *
01158                                            MSEC_PER_SEC);
01159 
01160         if (tx->tx_conn == NULL) {
01161                 kiblnd_conn_addref(conn);
01162                 tx->tx_conn = conn;
01163                 LASSERT (tx->tx_msg->ibm_type != IBLND_MSG_PUT_DONE);
01164         } else {
01165                 /* PUT_DONE first attached to conn as a PUT_REQ */
01166                 LASSERT (tx->tx_conn == conn);
01167                 LASSERT (tx->tx_msg->ibm_type == IBLND_MSG_PUT_DONE);
01168         }
01169 
01170         switch (tx->tx_msg->ibm_type) {
01171         default:
01172                 LBUG();
01173 
01174         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_REQ:
01175         case IBLND_MSG_GET_REQ:
01176                 q = &conn->ibc_tx_queue_rsrvd;
01177                 break;
01178 
01179         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_NAK:
01180         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_ACK:
01181         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_DONE:
01182         case IBLND_MSG_GET_DONE:
01183                 q = &conn->ibc_tx_queue_nocred;
01184                 break;
01185 
01186         case IBLND_MSG_NOOP:
01187                 if (IBLND_OOB_CAPABLE(conn->ibc_version))
01188                         q = &conn->ibc_tx_queue_nocred;
01189                 else
01190                         q = &conn->ibc_tx_noops;
01191                 break;
01192 
01193         case IBLND_MSG_IMMEDIATE:
01194                 q = &conn->ibc_tx_queue;
01195                 break;
01196         }
01197 
01198         list_add_tail(&tx->tx_list, q);
01199 }
01200 
01201 static void
01202 kiblnd_queue_tx (kib_tx_t *tx, kib_conn_t *conn)
01203 {
01204         spin_lock(&conn->ibc_lock);
01205         kiblnd_queue_tx_locked(tx, conn);
01206         spin_unlock(&conn->ibc_lock);
01207 
01208         kiblnd_check_sends(conn);
01209 }
01210 
01211 static int kiblnd_resolve_addr(struct rdma_cm_id *cmid,
01212                                struct sockaddr_in *srcaddr,
01213                                struct sockaddr_in *dstaddr,
01214                                int timeout_ms)
01215 {
01216         unsigned short port;
01217         int rc;
01218 
01219         /* allow the port to be reused */
01220         rc = rdma_set_reuseaddr(cmid, 1);
01221         if (rc != 0) {
01222                 CERROR("Unable to set reuse on cmid: %d\n", rc);
01223                 return rc;
01224         }
01225 
01226         /* look for a free privileged port */
01227         for (port = PROT_SOCK-1; port > 0; port--) {
01228                 srcaddr->sin_port = htons(port);
01229                 rc = rdma_resolve_addr(cmid,
01230                                        (struct sockaddr *)srcaddr,
01231                                        (struct sockaddr *)dstaddr,
01232                                        timeout_ms);
01233                 if (rc == 0) {
01234                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "bound to port %hu\n", port);
01235                         return 0;
01236                 } else if (rc == -EADDRINUSE || rc == -EADDRNOTAVAIL) {
01237                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "bind to port %hu failed: %d\n",
01238                                port, rc);
01239                 } else {
01240                         return rc;
01241                 }
01242         }
01243 
01244         CERROR("Failed to bind to a free privileged port\n");
01245         return rc;
01246 }
01247 
01248 static void
01249 kiblnd_connect_peer (kib_peer_t *peer)
01250 {
01251         struct rdma_cm_id *cmid;
01252         kib_dev_t         *dev;
01253         kib_net_t         *net = peer->ibp_ni->ni_data;
01254         struct sockaddr_in srcaddr;
01255         struct sockaddr_in dstaddr;
01256         int                rc;
01257 
01258         LASSERT (net != NULL);
01259         LASSERT (peer->ibp_connecting > 0);
01260         LASSERT(!peer->ibp_reconnecting);
01261 
01262         cmid = kiblnd_rdma_create_id(kiblnd_cm_callback, peer, RDMA_PS_TCP,
01263                                      IB_QPT_RC);
01264 
01265         if (IS_ERR(cmid)) {
01266                 CERROR("Can't create CMID for %s: %ld\n",
01267                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid), PTR_ERR(cmid));
01268                 rc = PTR_ERR(cmid);
01269                 goto failed;
01270         }
01271 
01272         dev = net->ibn_dev;
01273         memset(&srcaddr, 0, sizeof(srcaddr));
01274         srcaddr.sin_family = AF_INET;
01275         srcaddr.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(dev->ibd_ifip);
01276 
01277         memset(&dstaddr, 0, sizeof(dstaddr));
01278         dstaddr.sin_family = AF_INET;
01279         dstaddr.sin_port = htons(*kiblnd_tunables.kib_service);
01280         dstaddr.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(LNET_NIDADDR(peer->ibp_nid));
01281 
01282         kiblnd_peer_addref(peer);               /* cmid's ref */
01283 
01284         if (*kiblnd_tunables.kib_use_priv_port) {
01285                 rc = kiblnd_resolve_addr(cmid, &srcaddr, &dstaddr,
01286                                          *kiblnd_tunables.kib_timeout * 1000);
01287         } else {
01288                 rc = rdma_resolve_addr(cmid,
01289                                        (struct sockaddr *)&srcaddr,
01290                                        (struct sockaddr *)&dstaddr,
01291                                        *kiblnd_tunables.kib_timeout * 1000);
01292         }
01293         if (rc != 0) {
01294                 /* Can't initiate address resolution:  */
01295                 CERROR("Can't resolve addr for %s: %d\n",
01296                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid), rc);
01297                 goto failed2;
01298         }
01299 
01300         LASSERT (cmid->device != NULL);
01301         CDEBUG(D_NET, "%s: connection bound to %s:%pI4h:%s\n",
01302                libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid), dev->ibd_ifname,
01303                &dev->ibd_ifip, cmid->device->name);
01304 
01305         return;
01306 
01307  failed2:
01308         kiblnd_peer_connect_failed(peer, 1, rc);
01309         kiblnd_peer_decref(peer);               /* cmid's ref */
01310         rdma_destroy_id(cmid);
01311         return;
01312  failed:
01313         kiblnd_peer_connect_failed(peer, 1, rc);
01314 }
01315 
01316 bool
01317 kiblnd_reconnect_peer(kib_peer_t *peer)
01318 {
01319         rwlock_t         *glock = &kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock;
01320         char             *reason = NULL;
01321         struct list_head  txs;
01322         unsigned long     flags;
01323 
01324         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&txs);
01325 
01326         write_lock_irqsave(glock, flags);
01327         if (peer->ibp_reconnecting == 0) {
01328                 if (peer->ibp_accepting)
01329                         reason = "accepting";
01330                 else if (peer->ibp_connecting)
01331                         reason = "connecting";
01332                 else if (!list_empty(&peer->ibp_conns))
01333                         reason = "connected";
01334                 else /* connected then closed */
01335                         reason = "closed";
01336 
01337                 goto no_reconnect;
01338         }
01339 
01340         LASSERT(!peer->ibp_accepting && !peer->ibp_connecting &&
01341                 list_empty(&peer->ibp_conns));
01342         peer->ibp_reconnecting = 0;
01343 
01344         if (!kiblnd_peer_active(peer)) {
01345                 list_splice_init(&peer->ibp_tx_queue, &txs);
01346                 reason = "unlinked";
01347                 goto no_reconnect;
01348         }
01349 
01350         peer->ibp_connecting++;
01351         peer->ibp_reconnected++;
01352         write_unlock_irqrestore(glock, flags);
01353 
01354         kiblnd_connect_peer(peer);
01355         return true;
01356 
01357  no_reconnect:
01358         write_unlock_irqrestore(glock, flags);
01359 
01360         CWARN("Abort reconnection of %s: %s\n",
01361               libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid), reason);
01362         kiblnd_txlist_done(peer->ibp_ni, &txs, -ECONNABORTED);
01363         return false;
01364 }
01365 
01366 void
01367 kiblnd_launch_tx (lnet_ni_t *ni, kib_tx_t *tx, lnet_nid_t nid)
01368 {
01369         kib_peer_t        *peer;
01370         kib_peer_t        *peer2;
01371         kib_conn_t        *conn;
01372         rwlock_t        *g_lock = &kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock;
01373         unsigned long      flags;
01374         int                rc;
01375 
01376         /* If I get here, I've committed to send, so I complete the tx with
01377          * failure on any problems */
01378 
01379         LASSERT (tx == NULL || tx->tx_conn == NULL); /* only set when assigned a conn */
01380         LASSERT (tx == NULL || tx->tx_nwrq > 0);     /* work items have been set up */
01381 
01382         /* First time, just use a read lock since I expect to find my peer
01383          * connected */
01384         read_lock_irqsave(g_lock, flags);
01385 
01386         peer = kiblnd_find_peer_locked(nid);
01387         if (peer != NULL && !list_empty(&peer->ibp_conns)) {
01388                 /* Found a peer with an established connection */
01389                 conn = kiblnd_get_conn_locked(peer);
01390                 kiblnd_conn_addref(conn); /* 1 ref for me... */
01391 
01392                 read_unlock_irqrestore(g_lock, flags);
01393 
01394                 if (tx != NULL)
01395                         kiblnd_queue_tx(tx, conn);
01396                 kiblnd_conn_decref(conn); /* ...to here */
01397                 return;
01398         }
01399 
01400         read_unlock(g_lock);
01401         /* Re-try with a write lock */
01402         write_lock(g_lock);
01403 
01404         peer = kiblnd_find_peer_locked(nid);
01405         if (peer != NULL) {
01406                 if (list_empty(&peer->ibp_conns)) {
01407                         /* found a peer, but it's still connecting... */
01408                         LASSERT(kiblnd_peer_connecting(peer));
01409                         if (tx != NULL)
01410                                 list_add_tail(&tx->tx_list,
01411                                                   &peer->ibp_tx_queue);
01412                         write_unlock_irqrestore(g_lock, flags);
01413                 } else {
01414                         conn = kiblnd_get_conn_locked(peer);
01415                         kiblnd_conn_addref(conn); /* 1 ref for me... */
01416 
01417                         write_unlock_irqrestore(g_lock, flags);
01418 
01419                         if (tx != NULL)
01420                                 kiblnd_queue_tx(tx, conn);
01421                         kiblnd_conn_decref(conn); /* ...to here */
01422                 }
01423                 return;
01424         }
01425 
01426         write_unlock_irqrestore(g_lock, flags);
01427 
01428         /* Allocate a peer ready to add to the peer table and retry */
01429         rc = kiblnd_create_peer(ni, &peer, nid);
01430         if (rc != 0) {
01431                 CERROR("Can't create peer %s\n", libcfs_nid2str(nid));
01432                 if (tx != NULL) {
01433                         tx->tx_status = -EHOSTUNREACH;
01434                         tx->tx_waiting = 0;
01435                         kiblnd_tx_done(ni, tx);
01436                 }
01437                 return;
01438         }
01439 
01440         write_lock_irqsave(g_lock, flags);
01441 
01442         peer2 = kiblnd_find_peer_locked(nid);
01443         if (peer2 != NULL) {
01444                 if (list_empty(&peer2->ibp_conns)) {
01445                         /* found a peer, but it's still connecting... */
01446                         LASSERT(kiblnd_peer_connecting(peer2));
01447                         if (tx != NULL)
01448                                 list_add_tail(&tx->tx_list,
01449                                                   &peer2->ibp_tx_queue);
01450                         write_unlock_irqrestore(g_lock, flags);
01451                 } else {
01452                         conn = kiblnd_get_conn_locked(peer2);
01453                         kiblnd_conn_addref(conn); /* 1 ref for me... */
01454 
01455                         write_unlock_irqrestore(g_lock, flags);
01456 
01457                         if (tx != NULL)
01458                                 kiblnd_queue_tx(tx, conn);
01459                         kiblnd_conn_decref(conn); /* ...to here */
01460                 }
01461 
01462                 kiblnd_peer_decref(peer);
01463                 return;
01464         }
01465 
01466         /* Brand new peer */
01467         LASSERT (peer->ibp_connecting == 0);
01468         peer->ibp_connecting = 1;
01469 
01470         /* always called with a ref on ni, which prevents ni being shutdown */
01471         LASSERT (((kib_net_t *)ni->ni_data)->ibn_shutdown == 0);
01472 
01473         if (tx != NULL)
01474                 list_add_tail(&tx->tx_list, &peer->ibp_tx_queue);
01475 
01476         kiblnd_peer_addref(peer);
01477         list_add_tail(&peer->ibp_list, kiblnd_nid2peerlist(nid));
01478 
01479         write_unlock_irqrestore(g_lock, flags);
01480 
01481         kiblnd_connect_peer(peer);
01482         kiblnd_peer_decref(peer);
01483 }
01484 
01485 int
01486 kiblnd_send (lnet_ni_t *ni, void *private, lnet_msg_t *lntmsg)
01487 {
01488         lnet_hdr_t       *hdr = &lntmsg->msg_hdr;
01489         int               type = lntmsg->msg_type;
01490         lnet_process_id_t target = lntmsg->msg_target;
01491         int               target_is_router = lntmsg->msg_target_is_router;
01492         int               routing = lntmsg->msg_routing;
01493         unsigned int      payload_niov = lntmsg->msg_niov;
01494         struct kvec      *payload_iov = lntmsg->msg_iov;
01495         lnet_kiov_t      *payload_kiov = lntmsg->msg_kiov;
01496         unsigned int      payload_offset = lntmsg->msg_offset;
01497         unsigned int      payload_nob = lntmsg->msg_len;
01498         kib_msg_t        *ibmsg;
01499         kib_rdma_desc_t  *rd;
01500         kib_tx_t         *tx;
01501         int               nob;
01502         int               rc;
01503 
01504         /* NB 'private' is different depending on what we're sending.... */
01505 
01506         CDEBUG(D_NET, "sending %d bytes in %d frags to %s\n",
01507                payload_nob, payload_niov, libcfs_id2str(target));
01508 
01509         LASSERT (payload_nob == 0 || payload_niov > 0);
01510         LASSERT (payload_niov <= LNET_MAX_IOV);
01511 
01512         /* Thread context */
01513         LASSERT (!in_interrupt());
01514         /* payload is either all vaddrs or all pages */
01515         LASSERT (!(payload_kiov != NULL && payload_iov != NULL));
01516 
01517         switch (type) {
01518         default:
01519                 LBUG();
01520                 return (-EIO);
01521 
01522         case LNET_MSG_ACK:
01523                 LASSERT (payload_nob == 0);
01524                 break;
01525 
01526         case LNET_MSG_GET:
01527                 if (routing || target_is_router)
01528                         break;                  /* send IMMEDIATE */
01529 
01530                 /* is the REPLY message too small for RDMA? */
01531                 nob = offsetof(kib_msg_t, ibm_u.immediate.ibim_payload[lntmsg->msg_md->md_length]);
01532                 if (nob <= IBLND_MSG_SIZE)
01533                         break;                  /* send IMMEDIATE */
01534 
01535                 tx = kiblnd_get_idle_tx(ni, target.nid);
01536                 if (tx == NULL) {
01537                         CERROR("Can't allocate txd for GET to %s\n",
01538                                libcfs_nid2str(target.nid));
01539                         return -ENOMEM;
01540                 }
01541 
01542                 ibmsg = tx->tx_msg;
01543                 rd = &ibmsg->ibm_u.get.ibgm_rd;
01544                 if ((lntmsg->msg_md->md_options & LNET_MD_KIOV) == 0)
01545                         rc = kiblnd_setup_rd_iov(ni, tx, rd,
01546                                                  lntmsg->msg_md->md_niov,
01547                                                  lntmsg->msg_md->md_iov.iov,
01548                                                  0, lntmsg->msg_md->md_length);
01549                 else
01550                         rc = kiblnd_setup_rd_kiov(ni, tx, rd,
01551                                                   lntmsg->msg_md->md_niov,
01552                                                   lntmsg->msg_md->md_iov.kiov,
01553                                                   0, lntmsg->msg_md->md_length);
01554                 if (rc != 0) {
01555                         CERROR("Can't setup GET sink for %s: %d\n",
01556                                libcfs_nid2str(target.nid), rc);
01557                         kiblnd_tx_done(ni, tx);
01558                         return -EIO;
01559                 }
01560 
01561                 nob = offsetof(kib_get_msg_t, ibgm_rd.rd_frags[rd->rd_nfrags]);
01562                 ibmsg->ibm_u.get.ibgm_cookie = tx->tx_cookie;
01563                 ibmsg->ibm_u.get.ibgm_hdr = *hdr;
01564 
01565                 kiblnd_init_tx_msg(ni, tx, IBLND_MSG_GET_REQ, nob);
01566 
01567                 tx->tx_lntmsg[1] = lnet_create_reply_msg(ni, lntmsg);
01568                 if (tx->tx_lntmsg[1] == NULL) {
01569                         CERROR("Can't create reply for GET -> %s\n",
01570                                libcfs_nid2str(target.nid));
01571                         kiblnd_tx_done(ni, tx);
01572                         return -EIO;
01573                 }
01574 
01575                 tx->tx_lntmsg[0] = lntmsg;      /* finalise lntmsg[0,1] on completion */
01576                 tx->tx_waiting = 1;             /* waiting for GET_DONE */
01577                 kiblnd_launch_tx(ni, tx, target.nid);
01578                 return 0;
01579 
01580         case LNET_MSG_REPLY:
01581         case LNET_MSG_PUT:
01582                 /* Is the payload small enough not to need RDMA? */
01583                 nob = offsetof(kib_msg_t, ibm_u.immediate.ibim_payload[payload_nob]);
01584                 if (nob <= IBLND_MSG_SIZE)
01585                         break;                  /* send IMMEDIATE */
01586 
01587                 tx = kiblnd_get_idle_tx(ni, target.nid);
01588                 if (tx == NULL) {
01589                         CERROR("Can't allocate %s txd for %s\n",
01590                                type == LNET_MSG_PUT ? "PUT" : "REPLY",
01591                                libcfs_nid2str(target.nid));
01592                         return -ENOMEM;
01593                 }
01594 
01595                 if (payload_kiov == NULL)
01596                         rc = kiblnd_setup_rd_iov(ni, tx, tx->tx_rd,
01597                                                  payload_niov, payload_iov,
01598                                                  payload_offset, payload_nob);
01599                 else
01600                         rc = kiblnd_setup_rd_kiov(ni, tx, tx->tx_rd,
01601                                                   payload_niov, payload_kiov,
01602                                                   payload_offset, payload_nob);
01603                 if (rc != 0) {
01604                         CERROR("Can't setup PUT src for %s: %d\n",
01605                                libcfs_nid2str(target.nid), rc);
01606                         kiblnd_tx_done(ni, tx);
01607                         return -EIO;
01608                 }
01609 
01610                 ibmsg = tx->tx_msg;
01611                 ibmsg->ibm_u.putreq.ibprm_hdr = *hdr;
01612                 ibmsg->ibm_u.putreq.ibprm_cookie = tx->tx_cookie;
01613                 kiblnd_init_tx_msg(ni, tx, IBLND_MSG_PUT_REQ, sizeof(kib_putreq_msg_t));
01614 
01615                 tx->tx_lntmsg[0] = lntmsg;      /* finalise lntmsg on completion */
01616                 tx->tx_waiting = 1;             /* waiting for PUT_{ACK,NAK} */
01617                 kiblnd_launch_tx(ni, tx, target.nid);
01618                 return 0;
01619         }
01620 
01621         /* send IMMEDIATE */
01622 
01623         LASSERT (offsetof(kib_msg_t, ibm_u.immediate.ibim_payload[payload_nob])
01624                  <= IBLND_MSG_SIZE);
01625 
01626         tx = kiblnd_get_idle_tx(ni, target.nid);
01627         if (tx == NULL) {
01628                 CERROR ("Can't send %d to %s: tx descs exhausted\n",
01629                         type, libcfs_nid2str(target.nid));
01630                 return -ENOMEM;
01631         }
01632 
01633         ibmsg = tx->tx_msg;
01634         ibmsg->ibm_u.immediate.ibim_hdr = *hdr;
01635 
01636         if (payload_kiov != NULL)
01637                 lnet_copy_kiov2flat(IBLND_MSG_SIZE, ibmsg,
01638                                     offsetof(kib_msg_t, ibm_u.immediate.ibim_payload),
01639                                     payload_niov, payload_kiov,
01640                                     payload_offset, payload_nob);
01641         else
01642                 lnet_copy_iov2flat(IBLND_MSG_SIZE, ibmsg,
01643                                    offsetof(kib_msg_t, ibm_u.immediate.ibim_payload),
01644                                    payload_niov, payload_iov,
01645                                    payload_offset, payload_nob);
01646 
01647         nob = offsetof(kib_immediate_msg_t, ibim_payload[payload_nob]);
01648         kiblnd_init_tx_msg(ni, tx, IBLND_MSG_IMMEDIATE, nob);
01649 
01650         tx->tx_lntmsg[0] = lntmsg;              /* finalise lntmsg on completion */
01651         kiblnd_launch_tx(ni, tx, target.nid);
01652         return 0;
01653 }
01654 
01655 static void
01656 kiblnd_reply (lnet_ni_t *ni, kib_rx_t *rx, lnet_msg_t *lntmsg)
01657 {
01658         lnet_process_id_t target = lntmsg->msg_target;
01659         unsigned int      niov = lntmsg->msg_niov;
01660         struct kvec      *iov = lntmsg->msg_iov;
01661         lnet_kiov_t      *kiov = lntmsg->msg_kiov;
01662         unsigned int      offset = lntmsg->msg_offset;
01663         unsigned int      nob = lntmsg->msg_len;
01664         kib_tx_t         *tx;
01665         int               rc;
01666 
01667         tx = kiblnd_get_idle_tx(ni, rx->rx_conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid);
01668         if (tx == NULL) {
01669                 CERROR("Can't get tx for REPLY to %s\n",
01670                        libcfs_nid2str(target.nid));
01671                 goto failed_0;
01672         }
01673 
01674         if (nob == 0)
01675                 rc = 0;
01676         else if (kiov == NULL)
01677                 rc = kiblnd_setup_rd_iov(ni, tx, tx->tx_rd,
01678                                          niov, iov, offset, nob);
01679         else
01680                 rc = kiblnd_setup_rd_kiov(ni, tx, tx->tx_rd,
01681                                           niov, kiov, offset, nob);
01682 
01683         if (rc != 0) {
01684                 CERROR("Can't setup GET src for %s: %d\n",
01685                        libcfs_nid2str(target.nid), rc);
01686                 goto failed_1;
01687         }
01688 
01689         rc = kiblnd_init_rdma(rx->rx_conn, tx,
01690                               IBLND_MSG_GET_DONE, nob,
01691                               &rx->rx_msg->ibm_u.get.ibgm_rd,
01692                               rx->rx_msg->ibm_u.get.ibgm_cookie);
01693         if (rc < 0) {
01694                 CERROR("Can't setup rdma for GET from %s: %d\n",
01695                        libcfs_nid2str(target.nid), rc);
01696                 goto failed_1;
01697         }
01698         
01699         if (nob == 0) {
01700                 /* No RDMA: local completion may happen now! */
01701                 lnet_finalize(ni, lntmsg, 0);
01702         } else {
01703                 /* RDMA: lnet_finalize(lntmsg) when it
01704                  * completes */
01705                 tx->tx_lntmsg[0] = lntmsg;
01706         }
01707 
01708         kiblnd_queue_tx(tx, rx->rx_conn);
01709         return;
01710 
01711  failed_1:
01712         kiblnd_tx_done(ni, tx);
01713  failed_0:
01714         lnet_finalize(ni, lntmsg, -EIO);
01715 }
01716 
01717 int
01718 kiblnd_recv(lnet_ni_t *ni, void *private, lnet_msg_t *lntmsg, int delayed,
01719             unsigned int niov, struct kvec *iov, lnet_kiov_t *kiov,
01720             unsigned int offset, unsigned int mlen, unsigned int rlen)
01721 {
01722         kib_rx_t    *rx = private;
01723         kib_msg_t   *rxmsg = rx->rx_msg;
01724         kib_conn_t  *conn = rx->rx_conn;
01725         kib_tx_t    *tx;
01726         int          nob;
01727         int          post_credit = IBLND_POSTRX_PEER_CREDIT;
01728         int          rc = 0;
01729 
01730         LASSERT (mlen <= rlen);
01731         LASSERT (!in_interrupt());
01732         /* Either all pages or all vaddrs */
01733         LASSERT (!(kiov != NULL && iov != NULL));
01734 
01735         switch (rxmsg->ibm_type) {
01736         default:
01737                 LBUG();
01738 
01739         case IBLND_MSG_IMMEDIATE:
01740                 nob = offsetof(kib_msg_t, ibm_u.immediate.ibim_payload[rlen]);
01741                 if (nob > rx->rx_nob) {
01742                         CERROR ("Immediate message from %s too big: %d(%d)\n",
01743                                 libcfs_nid2str(rxmsg->ibm_u.immediate.ibim_hdr.src_nid),
01744                                 nob, rx->rx_nob);
01745                         rc = -EPROTO;
01746                         break;
01747                 }
01748 
01749                 if (kiov != NULL)
01750                         lnet_copy_flat2kiov(niov, kiov, offset,
01751                                             IBLND_MSG_SIZE, rxmsg,
01752                                             offsetof(kib_msg_t, ibm_u.immediate.ibim_payload),
01753                                             mlen);
01754                 else
01755                         lnet_copy_flat2iov(niov, iov, offset,
01756                                            IBLND_MSG_SIZE, rxmsg,
01757                                            offsetof(kib_msg_t, ibm_u.immediate.ibim_payload),
01758                                            mlen);
01759                 lnet_finalize (ni, lntmsg, 0);
01760                 break;
01761 
01762         case IBLND_MSG_PUT_REQ: {
01763                 kib_msg_t       *txmsg;
01764                 kib_rdma_desc_t *rd;
01765 
01766                 if (mlen == 0) {
01767                         lnet_finalize(ni, lntmsg, 0);
01768                         kiblnd_send_completion(rx->rx_conn, IBLND_MSG_PUT_NAK, 0,
01769                                                rxmsg->ibm_u.putreq.ibprm_cookie);
01770                         break;
01771                 }
01772 
01773                 tx = kiblnd_get_idle_tx(ni, conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid);
01774                 if (tx == NULL) {
01775                         CERROR("Can't allocate tx for %s\n",
01776                                libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid));
01777                         /* Not replying will break the connection */
01778                         rc = -ENOMEM;
01779                         break;
01780                 }
01781 
01782                 txmsg = tx->tx_msg;
01783                 rd = &txmsg->ibm_u.putack.ibpam_rd;
01784                 if (kiov == NULL)
01785                         rc = kiblnd_setup_rd_iov(ni, tx, rd,
01786                                                  niov, iov, offset, mlen);
01787                 else
01788                         rc = kiblnd_setup_rd_kiov(ni, tx, rd,
01789                                                   niov, kiov, offset, mlen);
01790                 if (rc != 0) {
01791                         CERROR("Can't setup PUT sink for %s: %d\n",
01792                                libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid), rc);
01793                         kiblnd_tx_done(ni, tx);
01794                         /* tell peer it's over */
01795                         kiblnd_send_completion(rx->rx_conn, IBLND_MSG_PUT_NAK, rc,
01796                                                rxmsg->ibm_u.putreq.ibprm_cookie);
01797                         break;
01798                 }
01799 
01800                 nob = offsetof(kib_putack_msg_t, ibpam_rd.rd_frags[rd->rd_nfrags]);
01801                 txmsg->ibm_u.putack.ibpam_src_cookie = rxmsg->ibm_u.putreq.ibprm_cookie;
01802                 txmsg->ibm_u.putack.ibpam_dst_cookie = tx->tx_cookie;
01803 
01804                 kiblnd_init_tx_msg(ni, tx, IBLND_MSG_PUT_ACK, nob);
01805 
01806                 tx->tx_lntmsg[0] = lntmsg;      /* finalise lntmsg on completion */
01807                 tx->tx_waiting = 1;             /* waiting for PUT_DONE */
01808                 kiblnd_queue_tx(tx, conn);
01809 
01810                 /* reposted buffer reserved for PUT_DONE */
01811                 post_credit = IBLND_POSTRX_NO_CREDIT;
01812                 break;
01813                 }
01814 
01815         case IBLND_MSG_GET_REQ:
01816                 if (lntmsg != NULL) {
01817                         /* Optimized GET; RDMA lntmsg's payload */
01818                         kiblnd_reply(ni, rx, lntmsg);
01819                 } else {
01820                         /* GET didn't match anything */
01821                         kiblnd_send_completion(rx->rx_conn, IBLND_MSG_GET_DONE,
01822                                                -ENODATA,
01823                                                rxmsg->ibm_u.get.ibgm_cookie);
01824                 }
01825                 break;
01826         }
01827 
01828         kiblnd_post_rx(rx, post_credit);
01829         return rc;
01830 }
01831 
01832 int
01833 kiblnd_thread_start(int (*fn)(void *arg), void *arg, char *name)
01834 {
01835         struct task_struct *task = kthread_run(fn, arg, name);
01836 
01837         if (IS_ERR(task))
01838                 return PTR_ERR(task);
01839 
01840         atomic_inc(&kiblnd_data.kib_nthreads);
01841         return 0;
01842 }
01843 
01844 static void
01845 kiblnd_thread_fini (void)
01846 {
01847         atomic_dec (&kiblnd_data.kib_nthreads);
01848 }
01849 
01850 static void
01851 kiblnd_peer_alive (kib_peer_t *peer)
01852 {
01853         /* This is racy, but everyone's only writing cfs_time_current() */
01854         peer->ibp_last_alive = cfs_time_current();
01855         smp_mb();
01856 }
01857 
01858 static void
01859 kiblnd_peer_notify (kib_peer_t *peer)
01860 {
01861         int           error = 0;
01862         cfs_time_t    last_alive = 0;
01863         unsigned long flags;
01864 
01865         read_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
01866 
01867         if (kiblnd_peer_idle(peer) && peer->ibp_error != 0) {
01868                 error = peer->ibp_error;
01869                 peer->ibp_error = 0;
01870 
01871                 last_alive = peer->ibp_last_alive;
01872         }
01873 
01874         read_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
01875 
01876         if (error != 0)
01877                 lnet_notify(peer->ibp_ni,
01878                             peer->ibp_nid, 0, last_alive);
01879 }
01880 
01881 void
01882 kiblnd_close_conn_locked (kib_conn_t *conn, int error)
01883 {
01884         /* This just does the immediate housekeeping.  'error' is zero for a
01885          * normal shutdown which can happen only after the connection has been
01886          * established.  If the connection is established, schedule the
01887          * connection to be finished off by the connd.  Otherwise the connd is
01888          * already dealing with it (either to set it up or tear it down).
01889          * Caller holds kib_global_lock exclusively in irq context */
01890         kib_peer_t       *peer = conn->ibc_peer;
01891         kib_dev_t        *dev;
01892         unsigned long     flags;
01893 
01894         LASSERT (error != 0 || conn->ibc_state >= IBLND_CONN_ESTABLISHED);
01895 
01896         if (error != 0 && conn->ibc_comms_error == 0)
01897                 conn->ibc_comms_error = error;
01898 
01899         if (conn->ibc_state != IBLND_CONN_ESTABLISHED)
01900                 return; /* already being handled  */
01901 
01902         if (error == 0 &&
01903             list_empty(&conn->ibc_tx_noops) &&
01904             list_empty(&conn->ibc_tx_queue) &&
01905             list_empty(&conn->ibc_tx_queue_rsrvd) &&
01906             list_empty(&conn->ibc_tx_queue_nocred) &&
01907             list_empty(&conn->ibc_active_txs)) {
01908                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "closing conn to %s\n", 
01909                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid));
01910         } else {
01911                 CNETERR("Closing conn to %s: error %d%s%s%s%s%s\n",
01912                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid), error,
01913                        list_empty(&conn->ibc_tx_queue) ? "" : "(sending)",
01914                        list_empty(&conn->ibc_tx_noops) ? "" : "(sending_noops)",
01915                        list_empty(&conn->ibc_tx_queue_rsrvd) ?
01916                                                 "" : "(sending_rsrvd)",
01917                        list_empty(&conn->ibc_tx_queue_nocred) ?
01918                                                  "" : "(sending_nocred)",
01919                        list_empty(&conn->ibc_active_txs) ? "" : "(waiting)");
01920         }
01921 
01922         dev = ((kib_net_t *)peer->ibp_ni->ni_data)->ibn_dev;
01923         list_del(&conn->ibc_list);
01924         /* connd (see below) takes over ibc_list's ref */
01925 
01926         if (list_empty(&peer->ibp_conns) &&    /* no more conns */
01927             kiblnd_peer_active(peer)) {         /* still in peer table */
01928                 kiblnd_unlink_peer_locked(peer);
01929 
01930                 /* set/clear error on last conn */
01931                 peer->ibp_error = conn->ibc_comms_error;
01932         }
01933 
01934         kiblnd_set_conn_state(conn, IBLND_CONN_CLOSING);
01935 
01936         if (error != 0 &&
01937             kiblnd_dev_can_failover(dev)) {
01938                 list_add_tail(&dev->ibd_fail_list,
01939                               &kiblnd_data.kib_failed_devs);
01940                 wake_up(&kiblnd_data.kib_failover_waitq);
01941         }
01942 
01943         spin_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_connd_lock, flags);
01944
