01945         list_add_tail(&conn->ibc_list, &kiblnd_data.kib_connd_conns);
01946         wake_up(&kiblnd_data.kib_connd_waitq);
01947 
01948         spin_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_connd_lock, flags);
01949 }
01950 
01951 void
01952 kiblnd_close_conn(kib_conn_t *conn, int error)
01953 {
01954         unsigned long flags;
01955 
01956         write_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
01957 
01958         kiblnd_close_conn_locked(conn, error);
01959 
01960         write_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
01961 }
01962 
01963 static void
01964 kiblnd_handle_early_rxs(kib_conn_t *conn)
01965 {
01966         unsigned long    flags;
01967         kib_rx_t        *rx;
01968 
01969         LASSERT(!in_interrupt());
01970         LASSERT(conn->ibc_state >= IBLND_CONN_ESTABLISHED);
01971 
01972         write_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
01973         while (!list_empty(&conn->ibc_early_rxs)) {
01974                 rx = list_entry(conn->ibc_early_rxs.next,
01975                                     kib_rx_t, rx_list);
01976                 list_del(&rx->rx_list);
01977                 write_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
01978 
01979                 kiblnd_handle_rx(rx);
01980 
01981                 write_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
01982         }
01983         write_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
01984 }
01985 
01986 static void
01987 kiblnd_abort_txs(kib_conn_t *conn, struct list_head *txs)
01988 {
01989         struct list_head         zombies = LIST_HEAD_INIT(zombies);
01990         struct list_head        *tmp;
01991         struct list_head        *nxt;
01992         kib_tx_t                *tx;
01993 
01994         spin_lock(&conn->ibc_lock);
01995 
01996         list_for_each_safe(tmp, nxt, txs) {
01997                 tx = list_entry(tmp, kib_tx_t, tx_list);
01998 
01999                 if (txs == &conn->ibc_active_txs) {
02000                         LASSERT(!tx->tx_queued);
02001                         LASSERT(tx->tx_waiting ||
02002                                 tx->tx_sending != 0);
02003                 } else {
02004                         LASSERT(tx->tx_queued);
02005                 }
02006 
02007                 tx->tx_status = -ECONNABORTED;
02008                 tx->tx_waiting = 0;
02009 
02010                 if (tx->tx_sending == 0) {
02011                         tx->tx_queued = 0;
02012                         list_del(&tx->tx_list);
02013                         list_add(&tx->tx_list, &zombies);
02014                 }
02015         }
02016 
02017         spin_unlock(&conn->ibc_lock);
02018 
02019         kiblnd_txlist_done(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_ni, &zombies, -ECONNABORTED);
02020 }
02021 
02022 static void
02023 kiblnd_finalise_conn (kib_conn_t *conn)
02024 {
02025         LASSERT (!in_interrupt());
02026         LASSERT (conn->ibc_state > IBLND_CONN_INIT);
02027 
02028         kiblnd_set_conn_state(conn, IBLND_CONN_DISCONNECTED);
02029 
02030         /* abort_receives moves QP state to IB_QPS_ERR.  This is only required
02031          * for connections that didn't get as far as being connected, because
02032          * rdma_disconnect() does this for free. */
02033         kiblnd_abort_receives(conn);
02034 
02035         /* Complete all tx descs not waiting for sends to complete.
02036          * NB we should be safe from RDMA now that the QP has changed state */
02037 
02038         kiblnd_abort_txs(conn, &conn->ibc_tx_noops);
02039         kiblnd_abort_txs(conn, &conn->ibc_tx_queue);
02040         kiblnd_abort_txs(conn, &conn->ibc_tx_queue_rsrvd);
02041         kiblnd_abort_txs(conn, &conn->ibc_tx_queue_nocred);
02042         kiblnd_abort_txs(conn, &conn->ibc_active_txs);
02043 
02044         kiblnd_handle_early_rxs(conn);
02045 }
02046 
02047 static void
02048 kiblnd_peer_connect_failed(kib_peer_t *peer, int active, int error)
02049 {
02050         struct list_head zombies = LIST_HEAD_INIT(zombies);
02051         unsigned long   flags;
02052 
02053         LASSERT (error != 0);
02054         LASSERT (!in_interrupt());
02055 
02056         write_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
02057 
02058         if (active) {
02059                 LASSERT (peer->ibp_connecting > 0);
02060                 peer->ibp_connecting--;
02061         } else {
02062                 LASSERT (peer->ibp_accepting > 0);
02063                 peer->ibp_accepting--;
02064         }
02065 
02066         if (kiblnd_peer_connecting(peer)) {
02067                 /* another connection attempt under way... */
02068                 write_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock,
02069                                         flags);
02070                 return;
02071         }
02072 
02073         peer->ibp_reconnected = 0;
02074         if (list_empty(&peer->ibp_conns)) {
02075                 /* Take peer's blocked transmits to complete with error */
02076                 list_add(&zombies, &peer->ibp_tx_queue);
02077                 list_del_init(&peer->ibp_tx_queue);
02078 
02079                 if (kiblnd_peer_active(peer))
02080                         kiblnd_unlink_peer_locked(peer);
02081 
02082                 peer->ibp_error = error;
02083         } else {
02084                 /* Can't have blocked transmits if there are connections */
02085                 LASSERT(list_empty(&peer->ibp_tx_queue));
02086         }
02087 
02088         write_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
02089 
02090         kiblnd_peer_notify(peer);
02091 
02092         if (list_empty(&zombies))
02093                 return;
02094 
02095         CNETERR("Deleting messages for %s: connection failed\n",
02096                 libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid));
02097 
02098         kiblnd_txlist_done(peer->ibp_ni, &zombies, -EHOSTUNREACH);
02099 }
02100 
02101 static void
02102 kiblnd_connreq_done(kib_conn_t *conn, int status)
02103 {
02104         kib_peer_t       *peer = conn->ibc_peer;
02105         kib_tx_t         *tx;
02106         struct list_head txs;
02107         unsigned long    flags;
02108         int              active;
02109 
02110         active = (conn->ibc_state == IBLND_CONN_ACTIVE_CONNECT);
02111 
02112         CDEBUG(D_NET,"%s: active(%d), version(%x), status(%d)\n",
02113                libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid), active,
02114                conn->ibc_version, status);
02115 
02116         LASSERT (!in_interrupt());
02117         LASSERT ((conn->ibc_state == IBLND_CONN_ACTIVE_CONNECT &&
02118                   peer->ibp_connecting > 0) ||
02119                  (conn->ibc_state == IBLND_CONN_PASSIVE_WAIT &&
02120                   peer->ibp_accepting > 0));
02121 
02122         LIBCFS_FREE(conn->ibc_connvars, sizeof(*conn->ibc_connvars));
02123         conn->ibc_connvars = NULL;
02124 
02125         if (status != 0) {
02126                 /* failed to establish connection */
02127                 kiblnd_peer_connect_failed(peer, active, status);
02128                 kiblnd_finalise_conn(conn);
02129                 return;
02130         }
02131 
02132         /* connection established */
02133         write_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
02134 
02135         conn->ibc_last_send = jiffies;
02136         kiblnd_set_conn_state(conn, IBLND_CONN_ESTABLISHED);
02137         kiblnd_peer_alive(peer);
02138 
02139         /* Add conn to peer's list and nuke any dangling conns from a different
02140          * peer instance... */
02141         kiblnd_conn_addref(conn);       /* +1 ref for ibc_list */
02142         list_add(&conn->ibc_list, &peer->ibp_conns);
02143         peer->ibp_reconnected = 0;
02144         if (active)
02145                 peer->ibp_connecting--;
02146         else
02147                 peer->ibp_accepting--;
02148 
02149         if (peer->ibp_version == 0) {
02150                 peer->ibp_version     = conn->ibc_version;
02151                 peer->ibp_incarnation = conn->ibc_incarnation;
02152         }
02153 
02154         if (peer->ibp_version     != conn->ibc_version ||
02155             peer->ibp_incarnation != conn->ibc_incarnation) {
02156                 kiblnd_close_stale_conns_locked(peer, conn->ibc_version,
02157                                                 conn->ibc_incarnation);
02158                 peer->ibp_version     = conn->ibc_version;
02159                 peer->ibp_incarnation = conn->ibc_incarnation;
02160         }
02161 
02162         /* grab pending txs while I have the lock */
02163         list_add(&txs, &peer->ibp_tx_queue);
02164         list_del_init(&peer->ibp_tx_queue);
02165 
02166         if (!kiblnd_peer_active(peer) ||        /* peer has been deleted */
02167             conn->ibc_comms_error != 0) {       /* error has happened already */
02168                 lnet_ni_t *ni = peer->ibp_ni;
02169 
02170                 /* start to shut down connection */
02171                 kiblnd_close_conn_locked(conn, -ECONNABORTED);
02172                 write_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
02173 
02174                 kiblnd_txlist_done(ni, &txs, -ECONNABORTED);
02175 
02176                 return;
02177         }
02178 
02179         /* refcount taken by cmid is not reliable after I released the glock
02180          * because this connection is visible to other threads now, another
02181          * thread can find and close this connection right after I released
02182          * the glock, if kiblnd_cm_callback for RDMA_CM_EVENT_DISCONNECTED is
02183          * called, it can release the connection refcount taken by cmid.
02184          * It means the connection could be destroyed before I finish my
02185          * operations on it.
02186          */
02187         kiblnd_conn_addref(conn);
02188         write_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
02189 
02190         /* Schedule blocked txs */
02191         spin_lock(&conn->ibc_lock);
02192         while (!list_empty(&txs)) {
02193                 tx = list_entry(txs.next, kib_tx_t, tx_list);
02194                 list_del(&tx->tx_list);
02195 
02196                 kiblnd_queue_tx_locked(tx, conn);
02197         }
02198         spin_unlock(&conn->ibc_lock);
02199 
02200         kiblnd_check_sends(conn);
02201 
02202         /* schedule blocked rxs */
02203         kiblnd_handle_early_rxs(conn);
02204 
02205         kiblnd_conn_decref(conn);
02206 }
02207 
02208 static void
02209 kiblnd_reject(struct rdma_cm_id *cmid, kib_rej_t *rej)
02210 {
02211         int          rc;
02212 
02213         rc = rdma_reject(cmid, rej, sizeof(*rej));
02214 
02215         if (rc != 0)
02216                 CWARN("Error %d sending reject\n", rc);
02217 }
02218 
02219 static int
02220 kiblnd_passive_connect(struct rdma_cm_id *cmid, void *priv, int priv_nob)
02221 {
02222         rwlock_t                *g_lock = &kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock;
02223         kib_msg_t             *reqmsg = priv;
02224         kib_msg_t             *ackmsg;
02225         kib_dev_t             *ibdev;
02226         kib_peer_t            *peer;
02227         kib_peer_t            *peer2;
02228         kib_conn_t            *conn;
02229         lnet_ni_t             *ni  = NULL;
02230         kib_net_t             *net = NULL;
02231         lnet_nid_t             nid;
02232         struct rdma_conn_param cp;
02233         kib_rej_t              rej;
02234         int                    version = IBLND_MSG_VERSION;
02235         unsigned long          flags;
02236         int                    rc;
02237         struct sockaddr_in    *peer_addr;
02238         LASSERT (!in_interrupt());
02239 
02240         /* cmid inherits 'context' from the corresponding listener id */
02241         ibdev = (kib_dev_t *)cmid->context;
02242         LASSERT (ibdev != NULL);
02243 
02244         memset(&rej, 0, sizeof(rej));
02245         rej.ibr_magic                = IBLND_MSG_MAGIC;
02246         rej.ibr_why                  = IBLND_REJECT_FATAL;
02247         rej.ibr_cp.ibcp_max_msg_size = IBLND_MSG_SIZE;
02248 
02249         peer_addr = (struct sockaddr_in *)&(cmid->route.addr.dst_addr);
02250         if (*kiblnd_tunables.kib_require_priv_port &&
02251             ntohs(peer_addr->sin_port) >= PROT_SOCK) {
02252                 __u32 ip = ntohl(peer_addr->sin_addr.s_addr);
02253                 CERROR("Peer's port (%pI4h:%hu) is not privileged\n",
02254                        &ip, ntohs(peer_addr->sin_port));
02255                 goto failed;
02256         }
02257 
02258         if (priv_nob < offsetof(kib_msg_t, ibm_type)) {
02259                 CERROR("Short connection request\n");
02260                 goto failed;
02261         }
02262 
02263         /* Future protocol version compatibility support!  If the
02264          * o2iblnd-specific protocol changes, or when LNET unifies
02265          * protocols over all LNDs, the initial connection will
02266          * negotiate a protocol version.  I trap this here to avoid
02267          * console errors; the reject tells the peer which protocol I
02268          * speak. */
02269         if (reqmsg->ibm_magic == LNET_PROTO_MAGIC ||
02270             reqmsg->ibm_magic == __swab32(LNET_PROTO_MAGIC))
02271                 goto failed;
02272         if (reqmsg->ibm_magic == IBLND_MSG_MAGIC &&
02273             reqmsg->ibm_version != IBLND_MSG_VERSION &&
02274             reqmsg->ibm_version != IBLND_MSG_VERSION_1)
02275                 goto failed;
02276         if (reqmsg->ibm_magic == __swab32(IBLND_MSG_MAGIC) &&
02277             reqmsg->ibm_version != __swab16(IBLND_MSG_VERSION) &&
02278             reqmsg->ibm_version != __swab16(IBLND_MSG_VERSION_1))
02279                 goto failed;
02280 
02281         rc = kiblnd_unpack_msg(reqmsg, priv_nob);
02282         if (rc != 0) {
02283                 CERROR("Can't parse connection request: %d\n", rc);
02284                 goto failed;
02285         }
02286 
02287         nid = reqmsg->ibm_srcnid;
02288         ni  = lnet_net2ni(LNET_NIDNET(reqmsg->ibm_dstnid));
02289 
02290         if (ni != NULL) {
02291                 net = (kib_net_t *)ni->ni_data;
02292                 rej.ibr_incarnation = net->ibn_incarnation;
02293         }
02294 
02295         if (ni == NULL ||                         /* no matching net */
02296             ni->ni_nid != reqmsg->ibm_dstnid ||   /* right NET, wrong NID! */
02297             net->ibn_dev != ibdev) {              /* wrong device */
02298                 CERROR("Can't accept conn from %s on %s (%s:%d:%pI4h): "
02299                        "bad dst nid %s\n", libcfs_nid2str(nid),
02300                        ni == NULL ? "NA" : libcfs_nid2str(ni->ni_nid),
02301                        ibdev->ibd_ifname, ibdev->ibd_nnets,
02302                         &ibdev->ibd_ifip,
02303                        libcfs_nid2str(reqmsg->ibm_dstnid));
02304 
02305                 goto failed;
02306         }
02307 
02308        /* check time stamp as soon as possible */
02309         if (reqmsg->ibm_dststamp != 0 &&
02310             reqmsg->ibm_dststamp != net->ibn_incarnation) {
02311                 CWARN("Stale connection request\n");
02312                 rej.ibr_why = IBLND_REJECT_CONN_STALE;
02313                 goto failed;
02314         }
02315 
02316         /* I can accept peer's version */
02317         version = reqmsg->ibm_version;
02318 
02319         if (reqmsg->ibm_type != IBLND_MSG_CONNREQ) {
02320                 CERROR("Unexpected connreq msg type: %x from %s\n",
02321                        reqmsg->ibm_type, libcfs_nid2str(nid));
02322                 goto failed;
02323         }
02324 
02325         if (reqmsg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_queue_depth >
02326             kiblnd_msg_queue_size(version, ni)) {
02327                 CERROR("Can't accept conn from %s, queue depth too large: "
02328                        " %d (<=%d wanted)\n",
02329                        libcfs_nid2str(nid),
02330                        reqmsg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_queue_depth,
02331                        kiblnd_msg_queue_size(version, ni));
02332 
02333                 if (version == IBLND_MSG_VERSION)
02334                         rej.ibr_why = IBLND_REJECT_MSG_QUEUE_SIZE;
02335 
02336                 goto failed;
02337         }
02338 
02339         if (reqmsg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_max_frags >
02340             kiblnd_rdma_frags(version, ni)) {
02341                 CWARN("Can't accept conn from %s (version %x): "
02342                       "max_frags %d too large (%d wanted)\n",
02343                       libcfs_nid2str(nid), version,
02344                       reqmsg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_max_frags,
02345                       kiblnd_rdma_frags(version, ni));
02346 
02347                 if (version >= IBLND_MSG_VERSION)
02348                         rej.ibr_why = IBLND_REJECT_RDMA_FRAGS;
02349 
02350                 goto failed;
02351         } else if (reqmsg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_max_frags <
02352                    kiblnd_rdma_frags(version, ni) &&
02353                    net->ibn_fmr_ps == NULL) {
02354                 CWARN("Can't accept conn from %s (version %x): "
02355                       "max_frags %d incompatible without FMR pool "
02356                       "(%d wanted)\n",
02357                       libcfs_nid2str(nid), version,
02358                       reqmsg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_max_frags,
02359                       kiblnd_rdma_frags(version, ni));
02360 
02361                 if (version == IBLND_MSG_VERSION)
02362                         rej.ibr_why = IBLND_REJECT_RDMA_FRAGS;
02363 
02364                 goto failed;
02365         }
02366 
02367         if (reqmsg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_max_msg_size > IBLND_MSG_SIZE) {
02368                 CERROR("Can't accept %s: message size %d too big (%d max)\n",
02369                        libcfs_nid2str(nid),
02370                        reqmsg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_max_msg_size,
02371                        IBLND_MSG_SIZE);
02372                 goto failed;
02373         }
02374 
02375         /* assume 'nid' is a new peer; create  */
02376         rc = kiblnd_create_peer(ni, &peer, nid);
02377         if (rc != 0) {
02378                 CERROR("Can't create peer for %s\n", libcfs_nid2str(nid));
02379                 rej.ibr_why = IBLND_REJECT_NO_RESOURCES;
02380                 goto failed;
02381         }
02382 
02383         /* We have validated the peer's parameters so use those */
02384         peer->ibp_max_frags = reqmsg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_max_frags;
02385         peer->ibp_queue_depth = reqmsg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_queue_depth;
02386 
02387         write_lock_irqsave(g_lock, flags);
02388 
02389         peer2 = kiblnd_find_peer_locked(nid);
02390         if (peer2 != NULL) {
02391                 if (peer2->ibp_version == 0) {
02392                         peer2->ibp_version     = version;
02393                         peer2->ibp_incarnation = reqmsg->ibm_srcstamp;
02394                 }
02395 
02396                 /* not the guy I've talked with */
02397                 if (peer2->ibp_incarnation != reqmsg->ibm_srcstamp ||
02398                     peer2->ibp_version     != version) {
02399                         kiblnd_close_peer_conns_locked(peer2, -ESTALE);
02400 
02401                         if (kiblnd_peer_active(peer2)) {
02402                                 peer2->ibp_incarnation = reqmsg->ibm_srcstamp;
02403                                 peer2->ibp_version = version;
02404                         }
02405                         write_unlock_irqrestore(g_lock, flags);
02406 
02407                         CWARN("Conn stale %s version %x/%x incarnation "LPU64"/"LPU64"\n",
02408                               libcfs_nid2str(nid), peer2->ibp_version, version,
02409                               peer2->ibp_incarnation, reqmsg->ibm_srcstamp);
02410 
02411                         kiblnd_peer_decref(peer);
02412                         rej.ibr_why = IBLND_REJECT_CONN_STALE;
02413                         goto failed;
02414                 }
02415 
02416                 /* tie-break connection race in favour of the higher NID */
02417                 if (peer2->ibp_connecting != 0 &&
02418                     nid < ni->ni_nid) {
02419                         write_unlock_irqrestore(g_lock, flags);
02420 
02421                         CWARN("Conn race %s\n", libcfs_nid2str(peer2->ibp_nid));
02422 
02423                         kiblnd_peer_decref(peer);
02424                         rej.ibr_why = IBLND_REJECT_CONN_RACE;
02425                         goto failed;
02426                 }
02427                 /*
02428                  * passive connection is allowed even this peer is waiting for
02429                  * reconnection.
02430                  */
02431                 peer2->ibp_reconnecting = 0;
02432                 peer2->ibp_accepting++;
02433                 kiblnd_peer_addref(peer2);
02434 
02435                 /* Race with kiblnd_launch_tx (active connect) to create peer
02436                  * so copy validated parameters since we now know what the
02437                  * peer's limits are */
02438                 peer2->ibp_max_frags = peer->ibp_max_frags;
02439                 peer2->ibp_queue_depth = peer->ibp_queue_depth;
02440 
02441                 write_unlock_irqrestore(g_lock, flags);
02442                 kiblnd_peer_decref(peer);
02443                 peer = peer2;
02444         } else {
02445                 /* Brand new peer */
02446                 LASSERT (peer->ibp_accepting == 0);
02447                 LASSERT (peer->ibp_version == 0 &&
02448                          peer->ibp_incarnation == 0);
02449 
02450                 peer->ibp_accepting   = 1;
02451                 peer->ibp_version     = version;
02452                 peer->ibp_incarnation = reqmsg->ibm_srcstamp;
02453 
02454                 /* I have a ref on ni that prevents it being shutdown */
02455                 LASSERT (net->ibn_shutdown == 0);
02456 
02457                 kiblnd_peer_addref(peer);
02458                 list_add_tail(&peer->ibp_list, kiblnd_nid2peerlist(nid));
02459 
02460                 write_unlock_irqrestore(g_lock, flags);
02461         }
02462 
02463         conn = kiblnd_create_conn(peer, cmid, IBLND_CONN_PASSIVE_WAIT, version);
02464         if (conn == NULL) {
02465                 kiblnd_peer_connect_failed(peer, 0, -ENOMEM);
02466                 kiblnd_peer_decref(peer);
02467                 rej.ibr_why = IBLND_REJECT_NO_RESOURCES;
02468                 goto failed;
02469         }
02470 
02471         /* conn now "owns" cmid, so I return success from here on to ensure the
02472          * CM callback doesn't destroy cmid. */
02473         conn->ibc_incarnation      = reqmsg->ibm_srcstamp;
02474         conn->ibc_credits          = conn->ibc_queue_depth;
02475         conn->ibc_reserved_credits = conn->ibc_queue_depth;
02476         LASSERT(conn->ibc_credits + conn->ibc_reserved_credits +
02477                 IBLND_OOB_MSGS(version) <= IBLND_RX_MSGS(conn));
02478 
02479         ackmsg = &conn->ibc_connvars->cv_msg;
02480         memset(ackmsg, 0, sizeof(*ackmsg));
02481 
02482         kiblnd_init_msg(ackmsg, IBLND_MSG_CONNACK,
02483                         sizeof(ackmsg->ibm_u.connparams));
02484         ackmsg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_queue_depth  = conn->ibc_queue_depth;
02485         ackmsg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_max_frags    = conn->ibc_max_frags;
02486         ackmsg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_max_msg_size = IBLND_MSG_SIZE;
02487 
02488         kiblnd_pack_msg(ni, ackmsg, version, 0, nid, reqmsg->ibm_srcstamp);
02489 
02490         memset(&cp, 0, sizeof(cp));
02491         cp.private_data        = ackmsg;
02492         cp.private_data_len    = ackmsg->ibm_nob;
02493         cp.responder_resources = 0;             /* No atomic ops or RDMA reads */
02494         cp.initiator_depth     = 0;
02495         cp.flow_control        = 1;
02496         cp.retry_count         = *kiblnd_tunables.kib_retry_count;
02497         cp.rnr_retry_count     = *kiblnd_tunables.kib_rnr_retry_count;
02498 
02499         CDEBUG(D_NET, "Accept %s\n", libcfs_nid2str(nid));
02500 
02501         rc = rdma_accept(cmid, &cp);
02502         if (rc != 0) {
02503                 CERROR("Can't accept %s: %d\n", libcfs_nid2str(nid), rc);
02504                 rej.ibr_version = version;
02505                 rej.ibr_why     = IBLND_REJECT_FATAL;
02506 
02507                 kiblnd_reject(cmid, &rej);
02508                 kiblnd_connreq_done(conn, rc);
02509                 kiblnd_conn_decref(conn);
02510         }
02511 
02512         lnet_ni_decref(ni);
02513         return 0;
02514 
02515  failed:
02516         if (ni != NULL)
02517                 lnet_ni_decref(ni);
02518 
02519         rej.ibr_version = version;
02520         rej.ibr_cp.ibcp_queue_depth = kiblnd_msg_queue_size(version, ni);
02521         rej.ibr_cp.ibcp_max_frags   = kiblnd_rdma_frags(version, ni);
02522         kiblnd_reject(cmid, &rej);
02523 
02524         return -ECONNREFUSED;
02525 }
02526 
02527 static void
02528 kiblnd_check_reconnect(kib_conn_t *conn, int version,
02529                        __u64 incarnation, int why, kib_connparams_t *cp)
02530 {
02531         rwlock_t        *glock = &kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock;
02532         kib_peer_t      *peer = conn->ibc_peer;
02533         char            *reason;
02534         int              msg_size = IBLND_MSG_SIZE;
02535         int              frag_num = -1;
02536         int              queue_dep = -1;
02537         bool             reconnect;
02538         unsigned long    flags;
02539 
02540         LASSERT(conn->ibc_state == IBLND_CONN_ACTIVE_CONNECT);
02541         LASSERT(peer->ibp_connecting > 0);      /* 'conn' at least */
02542         LASSERT(!peer->ibp_reconnecting);
02543 
02544         if (cp) {
02545                 msg_size        = cp->ibcp_max_msg_size;
02546                 frag_num        = cp->ibcp_max_frags;
02547                 queue_dep       = cp->ibcp_queue_depth;
02548         }
02549 
02550         write_lock_irqsave(glock, flags);
02551         /* retry connection if it's still needed and no other connection
02552          * attempts (active or passive) are in progress
02553          * NB: reconnect is still needed even when ibp_tx_queue is
02554          * empty if ibp_version != version because reconnect may be
02555          * initiated by kiblnd_query() */
02556         reconnect = (!list_empty(&peer->ibp_tx_queue) ||
02557                      peer->ibp_version != version) &&
02558                     peer->ibp_connecting == 1 &&
02559                     peer->ibp_accepting == 0;
02560         if (!reconnect) {
02561                 reason = "no need";
02562                 goto out;
02563         }
02564 
02565         switch (why) {
02566         default:
02567                 reason = "Unknown";
02568                 break;
02569 
02570         case IBLND_REJECT_RDMA_FRAGS: {
02571                 struct lnet_ioctl_config_lnd_tunables *tunables;
02572 
02573                 if (!cp) {
02574                         reason = "can't negotiate max frags";
02575                         goto out;
02576                 }
02577                 tunables = peer->ibp_ni->ni_lnd_tunables;
02578                 if (!tunables->lt_tun_u.lt_o2ib.lnd_map_on_demand) {
02579                         reason = "map_on_demand must be enabled";
02580                         goto out;
02581                 }
02582                 if (conn->ibc_max_frags <= frag_num) {
02583                         reason = "unsupported max frags";
02584                         goto out;
02585                 }
02586 
02587                 peer->ibp_max_frags = frag_num;
02588                 reason = "rdma fragments";
02589                 break;
02590         }
02591         case IBLND_REJECT_MSG_QUEUE_SIZE:
02592                 if (!cp) {
02593                         reason = "can't negotiate queue depth";
02594                         goto out;
02595                 }
02596                 if (conn->ibc_queue_depth <= queue_dep) {
02597                         reason = "unsupported queue depth";
02598                         goto out;
02599                 }
02600 
02601                 peer->ibp_queue_depth = queue_dep;
02602                 reason = "queue depth";
02603                 break;
02604 
02605         case IBLND_REJECT_CONN_STALE:
02606                 reason = "stale";
02607                 break;
02608 
02609         case IBLND_REJECT_CONN_RACE:
02610                 reason = "conn race";
02611                 break;
02612 
02613         case IBLND_REJECT_CONN_UNCOMPAT:
02614                 reason = "version negotiation";
02615                 break;
02616         }
02617 
02618         conn->ibc_reconnect = 1;
02619         peer->ibp_reconnecting = 1;
02620         peer->ibp_version = version;
02621         if (incarnation != 0)
02622                 peer->ibp_incarnation = incarnation;
02623  out:
02624         write_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
02625 
02626         CNETERR("%s: %s (%s), %x, %x, msg_size: %d, queue_depth: %d/%d, max_frags: %d/%d\n",
02627                 libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid),
02628                 reconnect ? "reconnect" : "don't reconnect",
02629                 reason, IBLND_MSG_VERSION, version, msg_size,
02630                 conn->ibc_queue_depth, queue_dep,
02631                 conn->ibc_max_frags, frag_num);
02632         /*
02633          * if conn::ibc_reconnect is TRUE, connd will reconnect to the peer
02634          * while destroying the zombie
02635          */
02636 }
02637 
02638 static void
02639 kiblnd_rejected (kib_conn_t *conn, int reason, void *priv, int priv_nob)
02640 {
02641         kib_peer_t    *peer = conn->ibc_peer;
02642 
02643         LASSERT (!in_interrupt());
02644         LASSERT (conn->ibc_state == IBLND_CONN_ACTIVE_CONNECT);
02645 
02646         switch (reason) {
02647         case IB_CM_REJ_STALE_CONN:
02648                 kiblnd_check_reconnect(conn, IBLND_MSG_VERSION, 0,
02649                                        IBLND_REJECT_CONN_STALE, NULL);
02650                 break;
02651 
02652         case IB_CM_REJ_INVALID_SERVICE_ID:
02653                 CNETERR("%s rejected: no listener at %d\n",
02654                         libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid),
02655                         *kiblnd_tunables.kib_service);
02656                 break;
02657 
02658         case IB_CM_REJ_CONSUMER_DEFINED:
02659                 if (priv_nob >= offsetof(kib_rej_t, ibr_padding)) {
02660                         kib_rej_t        *rej         = priv;
02661                         kib_connparams_t *cp          = NULL;
02662                         int               flip        = 0;
02663                         __u64             incarnation = -1;
02664 
02665                         /* NB. default incarnation is -1 because:
02666                          * a) V1 will ignore dst incarnation in connreq.
02667                          * b) V2 will provide incarnation while rejecting me,
02668                          *    -1 will be overwrote.
02669                          *
02670                          * if I try to connect to a V1 peer with V2 protocol,
02671                          * it rejected me then upgrade to V2, I have no idea
02672                          * about the upgrading and try to reconnect with V1,
02673                          * in this case upgraded V2 can find out I'm trying to
02674                          * talk to the old guy and reject me(incarnation is -1). 
02675                          */
02676 
02677                         if (rej->ibr_magic == __swab32(IBLND_MSG_MAGIC) ||
02678                             rej->ibr_magic == __swab32(LNET_PROTO_MAGIC)) {
02679                                 __swab32s(&rej->ibr_magic);
02680                                 __swab16s(&rej->ibr_version);
02681                                 flip = 1;
02682                         }
02683 
02684                         if (priv_nob >= sizeof(kib_rej_t) &&
02685                             rej->ibr_version > IBLND_MSG_VERSION_1) {
02686                                 /* priv_nob is always 148 in current version
02687                                  * of OFED, so we still need to check version.
02688                                  * (define of IB_CM_REJ_PRIVATE_DATA_SIZE) */
02689                                 cp = &rej->ibr_cp;
02690 
02691                                 if (flip) {
02692                                         __swab64s(&rej->ibr_incarnation);
02693                                         __swab16s(&cp->ibcp_queue_depth);
02694                                         __swab16s(&cp->ibcp_max_frags);
02695                                         __swab32s(&cp->ibcp_max_msg_size);
02696                                 }
02697 
02698                                 incarnation = rej->ibr_incarnation;
02699                         }
02700 
02701                         if (rej->ibr_magic != IBLND_MSG_MAGIC &&
02702                             rej->ibr_magic != LNET_PROTO_MAGIC) {
02703                                 CERROR("%s rejected: consumer defined fatal error\n",
02704                                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid));
02705                                 break;
02706                         }
02707 
02708                         if (rej->ibr_version != IBLND_MSG_VERSION &&
02709                             rej->ibr_version != IBLND_MSG_VERSION_1) {
02710                                 CERROR("%s rejected: o2iblnd version %x error\n",
02711                                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid),
02712                                        rej->ibr_version);
02713                                 break;
02714                         }
02715 
02716                         if (rej->ibr_why     == IBLND_REJECT_FATAL &&
02717                             rej->ibr_version == IBLND_MSG_VERSION_1) {
02718                                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "rejected by old version peer %s: %x\n",
02719                                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid), rej->ibr_version);
02720 
02721                                 if (conn->ibc_version != IBLND_MSG_VERSION_1)
02722                                         rej->ibr_why = IBLND_REJECT_CONN_UNCOMPAT;
02723                         }
02724 
02725                         switch (rej->ibr_why) {
02726                         case IBLND_REJECT_CONN_RACE:
02727                         case IBLND_REJECT_CONN_STALE:
02728                         case IBLND_REJECT_CONN_UNCOMPAT:
02729                         case IBLND_REJECT_MSG_QUEUE_SIZE:
02730                         case IBLND_REJECT_RDMA_FRAGS:
02731                                 kiblnd_check_reconnect(conn, rej->ibr_version,
02732                                                 incarnation, rej->ibr_why, cp);
02733                                 break;
02734 
02735                         case IBLND_REJECT_NO_RESOURCES:
02736                                 CERROR("%s rejected: o2iblnd no resources\n",
02737                                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid));
02738                                 break;
02739 
02740                         case IBLND_REJECT_FATAL:
02741                                 CERROR("%s rejected: o2iblnd fatal error\n",
02742                                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid));
02743                                 break;
02744 
02745                         default:
02746                                 CERROR("%s rejected: o2iblnd reason %d\n",
02747                                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid),
02748                                        rej->ibr_why);
02749                                 break;
02750                         }
02751                         break;
02752                 }
02753                 /* fall through */
02754         default:
02755                 CNETERR("%s rejected: reason %d, size %d\n",
02756                         libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid), reason, priv_nob);
02757                 break;
02758         }
02759 
02760         kiblnd_connreq_done(conn, -ECONNREFUSED);
02761 }
02762 
02763 static void
02764 kiblnd_check_connreply (kib_conn_t *conn, void *priv, int priv_nob)
02765 {
02766         kib_peer_t    *peer = conn->ibc_peer;
02767         lnet_ni_t     *ni   = peer->ibp_ni;
02768         kib_net_t     *net  = ni->ni_data;
02769         kib_msg_t     *msg  = priv;
02770         int            ver  = conn->ibc_version;
02771         int            rc   = kiblnd_unpack_msg(msg, priv_nob);
02772         unsigned long  flags;
02773 
02774         LASSERT (net != NULL);
02775 
02776         if (rc != 0) {
02777                 CERROR("Can't unpack connack from %s: %d\n",
02778                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid), rc);
02779                 goto failed;
02780         }
02781 
02782         if (msg->ibm_type != IBLND_MSG_CONNACK) {
02783                 CERROR("Unexpected message %d from %s\n",
02784                        msg->ibm_type, libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid));
02785                 rc = -EPROTO;
02786                 goto failed;
02787         }
02788 
02789         if (ver != msg->ibm_version) {
02790                 CERROR("%s replied version %x is different with "
02791                        "requested version %x\n",
02792                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid), msg->ibm_version, ver);
02793                 rc = -EPROTO;
02794                 goto failed;
02795         }
02796 
02797         if (msg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_queue_depth >
02798             conn->ibc_queue_depth) {
02799                 CERROR("%s has incompatible queue depth %d (<=%d wanted)\n",
02800                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid),
02801                        msg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_queue_depth,
02802                        conn->ibc_queue_depth);
02803                 rc = -EPROTO;
02804                 goto failed;
02805         }
02806 
02807         if (msg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_max_frags >
02808             conn->ibc_max_frags) {
02809                 CERROR("%s has incompatible max_frags %d (<=%d wanted)\n",
02810                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid),
02811                        msg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_max_frags,
02812                        conn->ibc_max_frags);
02813                 rc = -EPROTO;
02814                 goto failed;
02815         }
02816 
02817         if (msg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_max_msg_size > IBLND_MSG_SIZE) {
02818                 CERROR("%s max message size %d too big (%d max)\n",
02819                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid),
02820                        msg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_max_msg_size,
02821                        IBLND_MSG_SIZE);
02822                 rc = -EPROTO;
02823                 goto failed;
02824         }
02825 
02826         read_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
02827         if (msg->ibm_dstnid == ni->ni_nid &&
02828             msg->ibm_dststamp == net->ibn_incarnation)
02829                 rc = 0;
02830         else
02831                 rc = -ESTALE;
02832         read_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
02833 
02834         if (rc != 0) {
02835                 CERROR("Bad connection reply from %s, rc = %d, "
02836                        "version: %x max_frags: %d\n",
02837                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid), rc,
02838                        msg->ibm_version, msg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_max_frags);
02839                 goto failed;
02840         }
02841 
02842         conn->ibc_incarnation      = msg->ibm_srcstamp;
02843         conn->ibc_credits          = msg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_queue_depth;
02844         conn->ibc_reserved_credits = msg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_queue_depth;
02845         conn->ibc_queue_depth      = msg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_queue_depth;
02846         conn->ibc_max_frags        = msg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_max_frags;
02847         LASSERT(conn->ibc_credits + conn->ibc_reserved_credits +
02848                 IBLND_OOB_MSGS(ver) <= IBLND_RX_MSGS(conn));
02849 
02850         kiblnd_connreq_done(conn, 0);
02851         return;
02852 
02853  failed:
02854         /* NB My QP has already established itself, so I handle anything going
02855          * wrong here by setting ibc_comms_error.
02856          * kiblnd_connreq_done(0) moves the conn state to ESTABLISHED, but then
02857          * immediately tears it down. */
02858 
02859         LASSERT (rc != 0);
02860         conn->ibc_comms_error = rc;
02861         kiblnd_connreq_done(conn, 0);
02862 }
02863 
02864 static int
02865 kiblnd_active_connect (struct rdma_cm_id *cmid)
02866 {
02867         kib_peer_t              *peer = (kib_peer_t *)cmid->context;
02868         kib_conn_t              *conn;
02869         kib_msg_t               *msg;
02870         struct rdma_conn_param   cp;
02871         int                      version;
02872         __u64                    incarnation;
02873         unsigned long            flags;
02874         int                      rc;
02875 
02876         read_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
02877 
02878         incarnation = peer->ibp_incarnation;
02879         version     = (peer->ibp_version == 0) ? IBLND_MSG_VERSION :
02880                                                  peer->ibp_version;
02881 
02882         read_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
02883 
02884         conn = kiblnd_create_conn(peer, cmid, IBLND_CONN_ACTIVE_CONNECT,
02885                                   version);
02886         if (conn == NULL) {
02887                 kiblnd_peer_connect_failed(peer, 1, -ENOMEM);
02888                 kiblnd_peer_decref(peer); /* lose cmid's ref */
02889                 return -ENOMEM;
02890         }
02891 
02892         /* conn "owns" cmid now, so I return success from here on to ensure the
02893          * CM callback doesn't destroy cmid. conn also takes over cmid's ref
02894          * on peer */
02895 
02896         msg = &conn->ibc_connvars->cv_msg;
02897 
02898         memset(msg, 0, sizeof(*msg));
02899         kiblnd_init_msg(msg, IBLND_MSG_CONNREQ, sizeof(msg->ibm_u.connparams));
02900         msg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_queue_depth  = conn->ibc_queue_depth;
02901         msg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_max_frags    = conn->ibc_max_frags;
02902         msg->ibm_u.connparams.ibcp_max_msg_size = IBLND_MSG_SIZE;
02903 
02904         kiblnd_pack_msg(peer->ibp_ni, msg, version,
02905                         0, peer->ibp_nid, incarnation);
02906 
02907         memset(&cp, 0, sizeof(cp));
02908         cp.private_data        = msg;
02909         cp.private_data_len    = msg->ibm_nob;
02910         cp.responder_resources = 0;             /* No atomic ops or RDMA reads */
02911         cp.initiator_depth     = 0;
02912         cp.flow_control        = 1;
02913         cp.retry_count         = *kiblnd_tunables.kib_retry_count;
02914         cp.rnr_retry_count     = *kiblnd_tunables.kib_rnr_retry_count;
02915 
02916         LASSERT(cmid->context == (void *)conn);
02917         LASSERT(conn->ibc_cmid == cmid);
02918 
02919         rc = rdma_connect(cmid, &cp);
02920         if (rc != 0) {
02921                 CERROR("Can't connect to %s: %d\n",
02922                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid), rc);
02923                 kiblnd_connreq_done(conn, rc);
02924                 kiblnd_conn_decref(conn);
02925         }
02926 
02927         return 0;
02928 }
02929 
02930 int
02931 kiblnd_cm_callback(struct rdma_cm_id *cmid, struct rdma_cm_event *event)
02932 {
02933         kib_peer_t  *peer;
02934         kib_conn_t  *conn;
02935         int          rc;
02936 
02937         switch (event->event) {
02938         default:
02939                 CERROR("Unexpected event: %d, status: %d\n",
02940                        event->event, event->status);
02941                 LBUG();
02942 
02943         case RDMA_CM_EVENT_CONNECT_REQUEST:
02944                 /* destroy cmid on failure */
02945                 rc = kiblnd_passive_connect(cmid, 
02946                                             (void *)KIBLND_CONN_PARAM(event),
02947                                             KIBLND_CONN_PARAM_LEN(event));
02948                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "connreq: %d\n", rc);
02949                 return rc;
02950                 
02951         case RDMA_CM_EVENT_ADDR_ERROR:
02952                 peer = (kib_peer_t *)cmid->context;
02953                 CNETERR("%s: ADDR ERROR %d\n",
02954                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid), event->status);
02955                 kiblnd_peer_connect_failed(peer, 1, -EHOSTUNREACH);
02956                 kiblnd_peer_decref(peer);
02957                 return -EHOSTUNREACH;      /* rc != 0 destroys cmid */
02958 
02959         case RDMA_CM_EVENT_ADDR_RESOLVED:
02960                 peer = (kib_peer_t *)cmid->context;
02961 
02962                 CDEBUG(D_NET,"%s Addr resolved: %d\n",
02963                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid), event->status);
02964 
02965                 if (event->status != 0) {
02966                         CNETERR("Can't resolve address for %s: %d\n",
02967                                 libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid), event->status);
02968                         rc = event->status;
02969                 } else {
02970                         rc = rdma_resolve_route(
02971                                 cmid, *kiblnd_tunables.kib_timeout * 1000);
02972                         if (rc == 0)
02973                                 return 0;
02974                         /* Can't initiate route resolution */
02975                         CERROR("Can't resolve route for %s: %d\n",
02976                                libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid), rc);
02977                 }
02978                 kiblnd_peer_connect_failed(peer, 1, rc);
02979                 kiblnd_peer_decref(peer);
02980                 return rc;                      /* rc != 0 destroys cmid */
02981 
02982         case RDMA_CM_EVENT_ROUTE_ERROR:
02983                 peer = (kib_peer_t *)cmid->context;
02984                 CNETERR("%s: ROUTE ERROR %d\n",
02985                         libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid), event->status);
02986                 kiblnd_peer_connect_failed(peer, 1, -EHOSTUNREACH);
02987                 kiblnd_peer_decref(peer);
02988                 return -EHOSTUNREACH;           /* rc != 0 destroys cmid */
02989 
02990         case RDMA_CM_EVENT_ROUTE_RESOLVED:
02991                 peer = (kib_peer_t *)cmid->context;
02992                 CDEBUG(D_NET,"%s Route resolved: %d\n",
02993                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid), event->status);
02994 
02995                 if (event->status == 0)
02996                         return kiblnd_active_connect(cmid);
02997 
02998                 CNETERR("Can't resolve route for %s: %d\n",
02999                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid), event->status);
03000                 kiblnd_peer_connect_failed(peer, 1, event->status);
03001                 kiblnd_peer_decref(peer);
03002                 return event->status;           /* rc != 0 destroys cmid */
03003                 
03004         case RDMA_CM_EVENT_UNREACHABLE:
03005                 conn = (kib_conn_t *)cmid->context;
03006                 LASSERT(conn->ibc_state == IBLND_CONN_ACTIVE_CONNECT ||
03007                         conn->ibc_state == IBLND_CONN_PASSIVE_WAIT);
03008                 CNETERR("%s: UNREACHABLE %d\n",
03009                        libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid), event->status);
03010                 kiblnd_connreq_done(conn, -ENETDOWN);
03011                 kiblnd_conn_decref(conn);
03012                 return 0;
03013 
03014         case RDMA_CM_EVENT_CONNECT_ERROR:
03015                 conn = (kib_conn_t *)cmid->context;
03016                 LASSERT(conn->ibc_state == IBLND_CONN_ACTIVE_CONNECT ||
03017                         conn->ibc_state == IBLND_CONN_PASSIVE_WAIT);
03018                 CNETERR("%s: CONNECT ERROR %d\n",
03019                         libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid), event->status);
03020                 kiblnd_connreq_done(conn, -ENOTCONN);
03021                 kiblnd_conn_decref(conn);
03022                 return 0;
03023 
03024         case RDMA_CM_EVENT_REJECTED:
03025                 conn = (kib_conn_t *)cmid->context;
03026                 switch (conn->ibc_state) {
03027                 default:
03028                         LBUG();
03029 
03030                 case IBLND_CONN_PASSIVE_WAIT:
03031                         CERROR ("%s: REJECTED %d\n",
03032                                 libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid),
03033                                 event->status);
03034                         kiblnd_connreq_done(conn, -ECONNRESET);
03035                         break;
03036 
03037                 case IBLND_CONN_ACTIVE_CONNECT:
03038                         kiblnd_rejected(conn, event->status,
03039                                         (void *)KIBLND_CONN_PARAM(event),
03040                                         KIBLND_CONN_PARAM_LEN(event));
03041                         break;
03042                 }
03043                 kiblnd_conn_decref(conn);
03044                 return 0;
03045 
03046         case RDMA_CM_EVENT_ESTABLISHED:
03047                 conn = (kib_conn_t *)cmid->context;
03048                 switch (conn->ibc_state) {
03049                 default:
03050                         LBUG();
03051 
03052                 case IBLND_CONN_PASSIVE_WAIT:
03053                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "ESTABLISHED (passive): %s\n",
03054                                libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid));
03055                         kiblnd_connreq_done(conn, 0);
03056                         break;
03057 
03058                 case IBLND_CONN_ACTIVE_CONNECT:
03059                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "ESTABLISHED(active): %s\n",
03060                                libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid));
03061                         kiblnd_check_connreply(conn,
03062                                                (void *)KIBLND_CONN_PARAM(event),
03063                                                KIBLND_CONN_PARAM_LEN(event));
03064                         break;
03065                 }
03066                 /* net keeps its ref on conn! */
03067                 return 0;
03068 
03069         case RDMA_CM_EVENT_TIMEWAIT_EXIT:
03070                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "Ignore TIMEWAIT_EXIT event\n");
03071                 return 0;
03072 
03073         case RDMA_CM_EVENT_DISCONNECTED:
03074                 conn = (kib_conn_t *)cmid->context;
03075                 if (conn->ibc_state < IBLND_CONN_ESTABLISHED) {
03076                         CERROR("%s DISCONNECTED\n",
03077                                libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid));
03078                         kiblnd_connreq_done(conn, -ECONNRESET);
03079                 } else {
03080                         kiblnd_close_conn(conn, 0);
03081                 }
03082                 kiblnd_conn_decref(conn);
03083                 cmid->context = NULL;
03084                 return 0;
03085 
03086         case RDMA_CM_EVENT_DEVICE_REMOVAL:
03087                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x131,
03088                                    "Received notification of device removal\n"
03089                                    "Please shutdown LNET to allow this to proceed\n");
03090                 /* Can't remove network from underneath LNET for now, so I have
03091                  * to ignore this */
03092                 return 0;
03093 
03094         case RDMA_CM_EVENT_ADDR_CHANGE:
03095                 LCONSOLE_INFO("Physical link changed (eg hca/port)\n");
03096                 return 0;
03097         }
03098 }
03099 
03100 static int
03101 kiblnd_check_txs_locked(kib_conn_t *conn, struct list_head *txs)
03102 {
03103         kib_tx_t         *tx;
03104         struct list_head *ttmp;
03105 
03106         list_for_each(ttmp, txs) {
03107                 tx = list_entry(ttmp, kib_tx_t, tx_list);
03108 
03109                 if (txs != &conn->ibc_active_txs) {
03110                         LASSERT(tx->tx_queued);
03111                 } else {
03112                         LASSERT(!tx->tx_queued);
03113                         LASSERT(tx->tx_waiting || tx->tx_sending != 0);
03114                 }
03115 
03116                 if (cfs_time_aftereq(jiffies, tx->tx_deadline)) {
03117                         CERROR("Timed out tx: %s, %lu seconds\n",
03118                                kiblnd_queue2str(conn, txs),
03119                                cfs_duration_sec(jiffies - tx->tx_deadline));
03120                         return 1;
03121                 }
03122         }
03123 
03124         return 0;
03125 }
03126 
03127 static int
03128 kiblnd_conn_timed_out_locked(kib_conn_t *conn)
03129 {
03130         return  kiblnd_check_txs_locked(conn, &conn->ibc_tx_queue) ||
03131                 kiblnd_check_txs_locked(conn, &conn->ibc_tx_noops) ||
03132                 kiblnd_check_txs_locked(conn, &conn->ibc_tx_queue_rsrvd) ||
03133                 kiblnd_check_txs_locked(conn, &conn->ibc_tx_queue_nocred) ||
03134                 kiblnd_check_txs_locked(conn, &conn->ibc_active_txs);
03135 }
03136 
03137 static void
03138 kiblnd_check_conns (int idx)
03139 {
03140         struct list_head  closes = LIST_HEAD_INIT(closes);
03141         struct list_head  checksends = LIST_HEAD_INIT(checksends);
03142         struct list_head *peers = &kiblnd_data.kib_peers[idx];
03143         struct list_head *ptmp;
03144         kib_peer_t       *peer;
03145         kib_conn_t       *conn;
03146         struct list_head *ctmp;
03147         unsigned long     flags;
03148 
03149         /* NB. We expect to have a look at all the peers and not find any
03150          * RDMAs to time out, so we just use a shared lock while we
03151          * take a look... */
03152         read_lock_irqsave(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
03153 
03154         list_for_each(ptmp, peers) {
03155                 peer = list_entry(ptmp, kib_peer_t, ibp_list);
03156 
03157                 list_for_each(ctmp, &peer->ibp_conns) {
03158                         int timedout;
03159                         int sendnoop;
03160 
03161                         conn = list_entry(ctmp, kib_conn_t, ibc_list);
03162 
03163                         LASSERT(conn->ibc_state == IBLND_CONN_ESTABLISHED);
03164 
03165                         spin_lock(&conn->ibc_lock);
03166 
03167                         sendnoop = kiblnd_need_noop(conn);
03168                         timedout = kiblnd_conn_timed_out_locked(conn);
03169                         if (!sendnoop && !timedout) {
03170                                 spin_unlock(&conn->ibc_lock);
03171                                 continue;
03172                         }
03173 
03174                         if (timedout) {
03175                                 CERROR("Timed out RDMA with %s (%lu): "
03176                                        "c: %u, oc: %u, rc: %u\n",
03177                                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->ibp_nid),
03178                                        cfs_duration_sec(cfs_time_current() -
03179                                                         peer->ibp_last_alive),
03180                                        conn->ibc_credits,
03181                                        conn->ibc_outstanding_credits,
03182                                        conn->ibc_reserved_credits);
03183                                 list_add(&conn->ibc_connd_list, &closes);
03184                         } else {
03185                                 list_add(&conn->ibc_connd_list, &checksends);
03186                         }
03187                         /* +ref for 'closes' or 'checksends' */
03188                         kiblnd_conn_addref(conn);
03189 
03190                         spin_unlock(&conn->ibc_lock);
03191                 }
03192         }
03193 
03194         read_unlock_irqrestore(&kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock, flags);
03195 
03196         /* Handle timeout by closing the whole
03197          * connection. We can only be sure RDMA activity
03198          * has ceased once the QP has been modified. */
03199         while (!list_empty(&closes)) {
03200                 conn = list_entry(closes.next,
03201                                   kib_conn_t, ibc_connd_list);
03202                 list_del(&conn->ibc_connd_list);
03203                 kiblnd_close_conn(conn, -ETIMEDOUT);
03204                 kiblnd_conn_decref(conn);
03205         }
03206 
03207         /* In case we have enough credits to return via a
03208          * NOOP, but there were no non-blocking tx descs
03209          * free to do it last time... */
03210         while (!list_empty(&checksends)) {
03211                 conn = list_entry(checksends.next,
03212                                   kib_conn_t, ibc_connd_list);
03213                 list_del(&conn->ibc_connd_list);
03214                 kiblnd_check_sends(conn);
03215                 kiblnd_conn_decref(conn);
03216         }
03217 }
03218 
03219 static void
03220 kiblnd_disconnect_conn (kib_conn_t *conn)
03221 {
03222         LASSERT (!in_interrupt());
03223         LASSERT (current == kiblnd_data.kib_connd);
03224         LASSERT (conn->ibc_state == IBLND_CONN_CLOSING);
03225 
03226         rdma_disconnect(conn->ibc_cmid);
03227         kiblnd_finalise_conn(conn);
03228 
03229         kiblnd_peer_notify(conn->ibc_peer);
03230 }
03231 
03232 /*
03233  * High-water for reconnection to the same peer, reconnection attempt should
03234  * be delayed after trying more than KIB_RECONN_HIGH_RACE.
03235  */
03236 #define KIB_RECONN_HIGH_RACE    10
03237 /*
03238  * Allow connd to take a break and handle other things after consecutive
03239  * reconnection attemps.
03240  */
03241 #define KIB_RECONN_BREAK        100
03242 
03243 int
03244 kiblnd_connd (void *arg)
03245 {
03246         spinlock_t        *lock= &kiblnd_data.kib_connd_lock;
03247         wait_queue_t       wait;
03248         unsigned long      flags;
03249         kib_conn_t        *conn;
03250         int                timeout;
03251         int                i;
03252         int                dropped_lock;
03253         int                peer_index = 0;
03254         unsigned long      deadline = jiffies;
03255 
03256         cfs_block_allsigs();
03257 
03258         init_waitqueue_entry(&wait, current);
03259         kiblnd_data.kib_connd = current;
03260 
03261         spin_lock_irqsave(lock, flags);
03262 
03263         while (!kiblnd_data.kib_shutdown) {
03264                 int reconn = 0;
03265 
03266                 dropped_lock = 0;
03267 
03268                 if (!list_empty(&kiblnd_data.kib_connd_zombies)) {
03269                         kib_peer_t *peer = NULL;
03270 
03271                         conn = list_entry(kiblnd_data.kib_connd_zombies.next,
03272                                           kib_conn_t, ibc_list);
03273                         list_del(&conn->ibc_list);
03274                         if (conn->ibc_reconnect) {
03275                                 peer = conn->ibc_peer;
03276                                 kiblnd_peer_addref(peer);
03277                         }
03278 
03279                         spin_unlock_irqrestore(lock, flags);
03280                         dropped_lock = 1;
03281 
03282                         kiblnd_destroy_conn(conn, !peer);
03283 
03284                         spin_lock_irqsave(lock, flags);
03285                         if (!peer)
03286                                 continue;
03287 
03288                         conn->ibc_peer = peer;
03289                         if (peer->ibp_reconnected < KIB_RECONN_HIGH_RACE)
03290                                 list_add_tail(&conn->ibc_list,
03291                                               &kiblnd_data.kib_reconn_list);
03292                         else
03293                                 list_add_tail(&conn->ibc_list,
03294                                               &kiblnd_data.kib_reconn_wait);
03295                 }
03296 
03297                 if (!list_empty(&kiblnd_data.kib_connd_conns)) {
03298                         conn = list_entry(kiblnd_data.kib_connd_conns.next,
03299                                               kib_conn_t, ibc_list);
03300                         list_del(&conn->ibc_list);
03301 
03302                         spin_unlock_irqrestore(lock, flags);
03303                         dropped_lock = 1;
03304 
03305                         kiblnd_disconnect_conn(conn);
03306                         kiblnd_conn_decref(conn);
03307 
03308                         spin_lock_irqsave(lock, flags);
03309                 }
03310 
03311                 while (reconn < KIB_RECONN_BREAK) {
03312                         if (kiblnd_data.kib_reconn_sec != get_seconds()) {
03313                                 kiblnd_data.kib_reconn_sec = get_seconds();
03314                                 list_splice_init(&kiblnd_data.kib_reconn_wait,
03315                                                  &kiblnd_data.kib_reconn_list);
03316                         }
03317 
03318                         if (list_empty(&kiblnd_data.kib_reconn_list))
03319                                 break;
03320 
03321                         conn = list_entry(kiblnd_data.kib_reconn_list.next,
03322                                           kib_conn_t, ibc_list);
03323                         list_del(&conn->ibc_list);
03324 
03325                         spin_unlock_irqrestore(lock, flags);
03326                         dropped_lock = 1;
03327 
03328                         reconn += kiblnd_reconnect_peer(conn->ibc_peer);
03329                         kiblnd_peer_decref(conn->ibc_peer);
03330                         LIBCFS_FREE(conn, sizeof(*conn));
03331 
03332                         spin_lock_irqsave(lock, flags);
03333                 }
03334 
03335                 /* careful with the jiffy wrap... */
03336                 timeout = (int)(deadline - jiffies);
03337                 if (timeout <= 0) {
03338                         const int n = 4;
03339                         const int p = 1;
03340                         int       chunk = kiblnd_data.kib_peer_hash_size;
03341 
03342                         spin_unlock_irqrestore(lock, flags);
03343                         dropped_lock = 1;
03344 
03345                         /* Time to check for RDMA timeouts on a few more
03346                          * peers: I do checks every 'p' seconds on a
03347                          * proportion of the peer table and I need to check
03348                          * every connection 'n' times within a timeout
03349                          * interval, to ensure I detect a timeout on any
03350                          * connection within (n+1)/n times the timeout
03351                          * interval. */
03352 
03353                         if (*kiblnd_tunables.kib_timeout > n * p)
03354                                 chunk = (chunk * n * p) /
03355                                         *kiblnd_tunables.kib_timeout;
03356                         if (chunk == 0)
03357                                 chunk = 1;
03358 
03359                         for (i = 0; i < chunk; i++) {
03360                                 kiblnd_check_conns(peer_index);
03361                                 peer_index = (peer_index + 1) %
03362                                              kiblnd_data.kib_peer_hash_size;
03363                         }
03364 
03365                         deadline += msecs_to_jiffies(p * MSEC_PER_SEC);
03366                         spin_lock_irqsave(lock, flags);
03367                 }
03368 
03369                 if (dropped_lock)
03370                         continue;
03371 
03372                 /* Nothing to do for 'timeout'  */
03373                 set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
03374                 add_wait_queue(&kiblnd_data.kib_connd_waitq, &wait);
03375                 spin_unlock_irqrestore(lock, flags);
03376 
03377                 schedule_timeout(timeout);
03378 
03379                 set_current_state(TASK_RUNNING);
03380                 remove_wait_queue(&kiblnd_data.kib_connd_waitq, &wait);
03381                 spin_lock_irqsave(lock, flags);
03382         }
03383 
03384         spin_unlock_irqrestore(lock, flags);
03385 
03386         kiblnd_thread_fini();
03387         return 0;
03388 }
03389 
03390 void
03391 kiblnd_qp_event(struct ib_event *event, void *arg)
03392 {
03393         kib_conn_t *conn = arg;
03394 
03395         switch (event->event) {
03396         case IB_EVENT_COMM_EST:
03397                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "%s established\n",
03398                        libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid));
03399                 return;
03400 
03401         default:
03402                 CERROR("%s: Async QP event type %d\n",
03403                        libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid), event->event);
03404                 return;
03405         }
03406 }
03407 
03408 static void
03409 kiblnd_complete (struct ib_wc *wc)
03410 {
03411         switch (kiblnd_wreqid2type(wc->wr_id)) {
03412         default:
03413                 LBUG();
03414 
03415         case IBLND_WID_MR:
03416                 if (wc->status != IB_WC_SUCCESS &&
03417                     wc->status != IB_WC_WR_FLUSH_ERR)
03418                         CNETERR("FastReg failed: %d\n", wc->status);
03419                 return;
03420 
03421         case IBLND_WID_RDMA:
03422                 /* We only get RDMA completion notification if it fails.  All
03423                  * subsequent work items, including the final SEND will fail
03424                  * too.  However we can't print out any more info about the
03425                  * failing RDMA because 'tx' might be back on the idle list or
03426                  * even reused already if we didn't manage to post all our work
03427                  * items */
03428                 CNETERR("RDMA (tx: %p) failed: %d\n",
03429                         kiblnd_wreqid2ptr(wc->wr_id), wc->status);
03430                 return;
03431 
03432         case IBLND_WID_TX:
03433                 kiblnd_tx_complete(kiblnd_wreqid2ptr(wc->wr_id), wc->status);
03434                 return;
03435 
03436         case IBLND_WID_RX:
03437                 kiblnd_rx_complete(kiblnd_wreqid2ptr(wc->wr_id), wc->status,
03438                                    wc->byte_len);
03439                 return;
03440         }
03441 }
03442 
03443 void
03444 kiblnd_cq_completion(struct ib_cq *cq, void *arg)
03445 {
03446         /* NB I'm not allowed to schedule this conn once its refcount has
03447          * reached 0.  Since fundamentally I'm racing with scheduler threads
03448          * consuming my CQ I could be called after all completions have
03449          * occurred.  But in this case, ibc_nrx == 0 && ibc_nsends_posted == 0
03450          * and this CQ is about to be destroyed so I NOOP. */
03451         kib_conn_t              *conn = (kib_conn_t *)arg;
03452         struct kib_sched_info   *sched = conn->ibc_sched;
03453         unsigned long           flags;
03454 
03455         LASSERT(cq == conn->ibc_cq);
03456 
03457         spin_lock_irqsave(&sched->ibs_lock, flags);
03458 
03459         conn->ibc_ready = 1;
03460 
03461         if (!conn->ibc_scheduled &&
03462             (conn->ibc_nrx > 0 ||
03463              conn->ibc_nsends_posted > 0)) {
03464                 kiblnd_conn_addref(conn); /* +1 ref for sched_conns */
03465                 conn->ibc_scheduled = 1;
03466                 list_add_tail(&conn->ibc_sched_list, &sched->ibs_conns);
03467 
03468                 if (waitqueue_active(&sched->ibs_waitq))
03469                         wake_up(&sched->ibs_waitq);
03470         }
03471 
03472         spin_unlock_irqrestore(&sched->ibs_lock, flags);
03473 }
03474 
03475 void
03476 kiblnd_cq_event(struct ib_event *event, void *arg)
03477 {
03478         kib_conn_t *conn = arg;
03479 
03480         CERROR("%s: async CQ event type %d\n",
03481                libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid), event->event);
03482 }
03483 
03484 int
03485 kiblnd_scheduler(void *arg)
03486 {
03487         long                    id = (long)arg;
03488         struct kib_sched_info   *sched;
03489         kib_conn_t              *conn;
03490         wait_queue_t            wait;
03491         unsigned long           flags;
03492         struct ib_wc            wc;
03493         int                     did_something;
03494         int                     busy_loops = 0;
03495         int                     rc;
03496 
03497         cfs_block_allsigs();
03498 
03499         init_waitqueue_entry(&wait, current);
03500 
03501         sched = kiblnd_data.kib_scheds[KIB_THREAD_CPT(id)];
03502 
03503         rc = cfs_cpt_bind(lnet_cpt_table(), sched->ibs_cpt);
03504         if (rc != 0) {
03505                 CWARN("Failed to bind on CPT %d, please verify whether "
03506                       "all CPUs are healthy and reload modules if necessary, "
03507                       "otherwise your system might under risk of low "
03508                       "performance\n", sched->ibs_cpt);
03509         }
03510 
03511         spin_lock_irqsave(&sched->ibs_lock, flags);
03512 
03513         while (!kiblnd_data.kib_shutdown) {
03514                 if (busy_loops++ >= IBLND_RESCHED) {
03515                         spin_unlock_irqrestore(&sched->ibs_lock, flags);
03516 
03517                         cond_resched();
03518                         busy_loops = 0;
03519 
03520                         spin_lock_irqsave(&sched->ibs_lock, flags);
03521                 }
03522 
03523                 did_something = 0;
03524 
03525                 if (!list_empty(&sched->ibs_conns)) {
03526                         conn = list_entry(sched->ibs_conns.next,
03527                                               kib_conn_t, ibc_sched_list);
03528                         /* take over kib_sched_conns' ref on conn... */
03529                         LASSERT(conn->ibc_scheduled);
03530                         list_del(&conn->ibc_sched_list);
03531                         conn->ibc_ready = 0;
03532 
03533                         spin_unlock_irqrestore(&sched->ibs_lock, flags);
03534 
03535                         wc.wr_id = IBLND_WID_INVAL;
03536 
03537                         rc = ib_poll_cq(conn->ibc_cq, 1, &wc);
03538                         if (rc == 0) {
03539                                 rc = ib_req_notify_cq(conn->ibc_cq,
03540                                                       IB_CQ_NEXT_COMP);
03541                                 if (rc < 0) {
03542                                         CWARN("%s: ib_req_notify_cq failed: %d, "
03543                                               "closing connection\n",
03544                                               libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid), rc);
03545                                         kiblnd_close_conn(conn, -EIO);
03546                                         kiblnd_conn_decref(conn);
03547                                         spin_lock_irqsave(&sched->ibs_lock,
03548                                                               flags);
03549                                         continue;
03550                                 }
03551 
03552                                 rc = ib_poll_cq(conn->ibc_cq, 1, &wc);
03553                         }
03554 
03555                         if (unlikely(rc > 0 && wc.wr_id == IBLND_WID_INVAL)) {
03556                                 LCONSOLE_ERROR(
03557                                         "ib_poll_cq (rc: %d) returned invalid "
03558                                         "wr_id, opcode %d, status: %d, "
03559                                         "vendor_err: %d, conn: %s status: %d\n"
03560                                         "please upgrade firmware and OFED or "
03561                                         "contact vendor.\n", rc,
03562                                         wc.opcode, wc.status, wc.vendor_err,
03563                                         libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid),
03564                                         conn->ibc_state);
03565                                 rc = -EINVAL;
03566                         }
03567 
03568                         if (rc < 0) {
03569                                 CWARN("%s: ib_poll_cq failed: %d, "
03570                                       "closing connection\n",
03571                                       libcfs_nid2str(conn->ibc_peer->ibp_nid),
03572                                       rc);
03573                                 kiblnd_close_conn(conn, -EIO);
03574                                 kiblnd_conn_decref(conn);
03575                                 spin_lock_irqsave(&sched->ibs_lock, flags);
03576                                 continue;
03577                         }
03578 
03579                         spin_lock_irqsave(&sched->ibs_lock, flags);
03580 
03581                         if (rc != 0 || conn->ibc_ready) {
03582                                 /* There may be another completion waiting; get
03583                                  * another scheduler to check while I handle
03584                                  * this one... */
03585                                 /* +1 ref for sched_conns */
03586                                 kiblnd_conn_addref(conn);
03587                                 list_add_tail(&conn->ibc_sched_list,
03588                                                   &sched->ibs_conns);
03589                                 if (waitqueue_active(&sched->ibs_waitq))
03590                                         wake_up(&sched->ibs_waitq);
03591                         } else {
03592                                 conn->ibc_scheduled = 0;
03593                         }
03594 
03595                         if (rc != 0) {
03596                                 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&sched->ibs_lock, flags);
03597                                 kiblnd_complete(&wc);
03598 
03599                                 spin_lock_irqsave(&sched->ibs_lock, flags);
03600                         }
03601 
03602                         kiblnd_conn_decref(conn); /* ...drop my ref from above */
03603                         did_something = 1;
03604                 }
03605 
03606                 if (did_something)
03607                         continue;
03608 
03609                 set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
03610                 add_wait_queue_exclusive(&sched->ibs_waitq, &wait);
03611                 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&sched->ibs_lock, flags);
03612 
03613                 schedule();
03614                 busy_loops = 0;
03615 
03616                 remove_wait_queue(&sched->ibs_waitq, &wait);
03617                 set_current_state(TASK_RUNNING);
03618                 spin_lock_irqsave(&sched->ibs_lock, flags);
03619         }
03620 
03621         spin_unlock_irqrestore(&sched->ibs_lock, flags);
03622 
03623         kiblnd_thread_fini();
03624         return 0;
03625 }
03626 
03627 int
03628 kiblnd_failover_thread(void *arg)
03629 {
03630         rwlock_t                *glock = &kiblnd_data.kib_global_lock;
03631         kib_dev_t               *dev;
03632         wait_queue_t            wait;
03633         unsigned long           flags;
03634         int                     rc;
03635 
03636         LASSERT(*kiblnd_tunables.kib_dev_failover != 0);
03637 
03638         cfs_block_allsigs();
03639 
03640         init_waitqueue_entry(&wait, current);
03641         write_lock_irqsave(glock, flags);
03642 
03643         while (!kiblnd_data.kib_shutdown) {
03644                 int     do_failover = 0;
03645                 int     long_sleep;
03646 
03647                 list_for_each_entry(dev, &kiblnd_data.kib_failed_devs,
03648                                     ibd_fail_list) {
03649                         if (cfs_time_before(cfs_time_current(),
03650                                             dev->ibd_next_failover))
03651                                 continue;
03652                         do_failover = 1;
03653                         break;
03654                 }
03655 
03656                 if (do_failover) {
03657                         list_del_init(&dev->ibd_fail_list);
03658                         dev->ibd_failover = 1;
03659                         write_unlock_irqrestore(glock, flags);
03660 
03661                         rc = kiblnd_dev_failover(dev);
03662 
03663                         write_lock_irqsave(glock, flags);
03664 
03665                         LASSERT (dev->ibd_failover);
03666                         dev->ibd_failover = 0;
03667                         if (rc >= 0) { /* Device is OK or failover succeed */
03668                                 dev->ibd_next_failover = cfs_time_shift(3);
03669                                 continue;
03670                         }
03671 
03672                         /* failed to failover, retry later */
03673                         dev->ibd_next_failover =
03674                                 cfs_time_shift(min(dev->ibd_failed_failover, 10));
03675                         if (kiblnd_dev_can_failover(dev)) {
03676                                 list_add_tail(&dev->ibd_fail_list,
03677                                               &kiblnd_data.kib_failed_devs);
03678                         }
03679 
03680                         continue;
03681                 }
03682 
03683                 /* long sleep if no more pending failover */
03684                 long_sleep = list_empty(&kiblnd_data.kib_failed_devs);
03685 
03686                 set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
03687                 add_wait_queue(&kiblnd_data.kib_failover_waitq, &wait);
03688                 write_unlock_irqrestore(glock, flags);
03689 
03690                 rc = schedule_timeout(long_sleep ? cfs_time_seconds(10) :
03691                                                    cfs_time_seconds(1));
03692                 set_current_state(TASK_RUNNING);
03693                 remove_wait_queue(&kiblnd_data.kib_failover_waitq, &wait);
03694                 write_lock_irqsave(glock, flags);
03695 
03696                 if (!long_sleep || rc != 0)
03697                         continue;
03698 
03699                 /* have a long sleep, routine check all active devices,
03700                  * we need checking like this because if there is not active
03701                  * connection on the dev and no SEND from local, we may listen
03702                  * on wrong HCA for ever while there is a bonding failover */
03703                 list_for_each_entry(dev, &kiblnd_data.kib_devs, ibd_list) {
03704                         if (kiblnd_dev_can_failover(dev)) {
03705                                 list_add_tail(&dev->ibd_fail_list,
03706                                               &kiblnd_data.kib_failed_devs);
03707                         }
03708                 }
03709         }
03710 
03711         write_unlock_irqrestore(glock, flags);
03712 
03713         kiblnd_thread_fini();
03714         return 0;
03715 }
